Manager Response: As you may expect, we were quite disturbed to read about your experience.  At your earliest convenience, please contact me directly at 714-698-6120 or at jleinacker@paseahotel.com  so that I may get more details regarding  incident.

Summary: Fantastic place to stay!  There is so much to do on site, as well as right next door.  This is our family’s new go to location.  The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.  I cannot day enough about how much we enjoyed our stay at this resort.
Manager Response: Dear tmcraig2000,  Thank you for this great review!  It means a great deal to us that you and your family had such a good stay with us and recommend us to the TripAdvisor audience.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea for another stay soon!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel was amazing!!! We got an early check when we arrived Saturday. We (7 girls) Enjoyed the pool  We enjoyed the day pass to the spa. Our dinner at tanners was amazing !!!! The hotel keys were so cute ! They give you a FREE bottle of wine and beach sandels. We asked for 4 robes per room. The robes were so comfortable! We bought one for our friend as a gift. Our two rooms (417/419)  were spacious. The Beds were so comfortable. The Bathroom was big and spacious. The location of the hotel was perfect.  Next to a bunch of restaurants ,shops and across from The beach 🏖   We will be going back this year !!!  Our group of 8 girls and agreed !!  We will book a Yearly girl trip ✅ Plus a Yearly couple trip ✅
Manager Response: Dear BVD_11,  We can't express how much this review means to us.  We thank you for publishing your experience and sharing some great things about our hotel.  We can't wait until your next stay so that we may exceed your expectations once again!!!!!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Everyone we encountered was pleasant and very service oriented. The location was exquisite and the view spectacular. We were able to check in early and check out a bit late. They offered extras like bikes, beach chairs and towels. Can't say a bad thing.
Manager Response: Dear C8518TSlaurah,  We were honored to receive such an outstanding review based on your recent stay with us at the the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  We will continue to deliver memorable experiences for our guests and we hope that includes you again in the near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Lovely Resort.  Rooms are modern, clean and comfortable.  Staff is out standing.  Pool was beautiful.  Tanner's restaurant was a little pricey, but the food was delicious and the service was excellent.  Although we did not have a chance to enjoy the spa, I heard good things about it from others.  I would definitely recommend this resort.
Manager Response: Dear 547alane,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future. Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We were looking for a hotel that would allow us to bring our yellow lab, and this is by far and away the most pet friendly hotel in Los Angeles area.  Check in and car valet are incredibly efficient, everyone seems happy to be working there too, which is a great sign.  Look forward to returning in May!
Manager Response: Dear Deborah B,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your recent stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Stayed on the 7th floor in a room with an ocean view. Great, clean, modern view. Food in the hotel restaurant was delicious. Also very close to the beach and mall where there are lots of stores and more restaurants.  We had a great stay :)
Manager Response: Dear mimi9753,  We're thrilled to hear you had a great stay and thank you for giving us the highest rating possible.  We will be looking forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: The spa was outstanding and the hotel location is ideal
Summary: The spa was great. Had a Swedish Massage after the Huntington Beach half marathon. It was excellent. The hotel is also very nice and accommodating after we had to extend our stay due to a snow storm back home and the airline cancelled our flight. They also give everyone a bottle of wine in their room and flip flops you can keep.  The rooms that face the pool get some noise from the restaurants so ask for an outside room if you need quiet before 11pm or so.
Manager Response: Dear Janice A,  Thank you for this great review and for noting many highlights of your stay.  We look forward to your next trip to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We had an ocean view room with a wrap-around lanai and the room as well as the property were very modern, trendy, and immaculate.  The room was generously sized.   Being a big fan of Meritage--specifically Koa Kea on Kauai, I had very high expectations for this stay.  I was disappointed by the road noise and the fact that the busy roadway separated the room from the beach.  This is no fault of Pasea's--all hotels are across the street from the beach.  The road noise does take away from what would otherwise be a peaceful stay.  I was also disappointed that there was no tub.  Staff were all very pleasant and accommodating although I wouldn't say that I was overly impressed compared to the over-and-above attitude from each and every staff member we encountered at Koa Kea and other
Manager Response: Dear GPC2,  We thank you for providing this very detailed review of our hotel based on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the compliments and high overall rating and even more so for the constructive feedback on how we can improve the experience for future guests.  We look forward to our next opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: SPECTACULAR HOTEL! excellent location & perfect for Surf City Marathon
Summary: Had a spectacular time at Pasea! The location is incredible, you can't get any closer to the ocean unless you're in the water. The restaurants on the property are delicious; Tanners has amazing food, I highly recommend the calamari, the pulled pork sandwich and the burger! The bar area is legit and has an awesome liquor storage room. The coffee shop "Blenders" has good coffee, the Treehouse Bar has the best views in Huntington Beach! We will definitely be coming back to hang out here especially during the air show. The rooms are absolutely beautiful with excellent views of the gorgeous Pacific Ocean!  They're spacious they're bright, very clean, comfy pillows and beds, the shower is awesome with doors that slide to make it open or private and coffee-bar inside your room; It's
Manager Response: Dear Natalia W,  Thank you for staying at Pasea Hotel & Spa and for taking time out of your day to post this review.  We're delighted that you had such a great experience at our resort, enjoying our unbeatable location, the spectacular views from our guest rooms, and our cool California coastal vibe. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea for another stay soon!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: As always, the Pasea was AWESOME!  I look forward to my visit every year.  The hotel staff is always inviting, and actually some remember me when they see me (I only come once a year for only a couple of days each visit). I am coming back soon for a personal trip to really enjoy the resort
Manager Response: Dear Alan D,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I recommend anyone visiting the O.C. to stay at the Pasea. It's literally steps from the beach, there's a shopping center right next door. The views from the room is breathtaking and the staff are wonderful. Our company event went on without a hitch. The food was great. And last but certainly not least, the shower .... SEXY!
Manager Response: Dear tiffanee_daniels,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your recent stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: 3th time visiting the Pasea Hotel & Spa , always the same service very welcome atmosphere , staff is very friendly and helpful.  The rooms always clean ( not to mention the complimentary bottle wine that comes with the price ). Me and my fiance have found the perfect weekend getaway spot . The beach view is an extra bonus !!!
Manager Response: Dear lazarosg2018,  We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to share your recent experience with us and specifically point out our amazing associates.  Thanks again for being our guest and we look forward to seeing you back with us again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We love staying at this resort mostly for the proximity to the beach and the close walk to downtown Huntington Beach and the Pier.  The hotel is an amazing blend of blues and sand colors, and puts you at ease the moment you walk into your room.  The restaurants are wonderful and the view is spectacular.
Manager Response: Dear paulbD9706JE,  Wow, we love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: grandma visit us and we decide to stay at this amazing hotel, the view is unbelievable and all my family had an awesome and unforgettable stay, I want to thank  ,Sergio ,Spenser, Jennifer and chef for the amazing customer service ,dinner was delicious new dishes and appetizers are the best in town, thank you all
Manager Response: Dear roy r,  We love this review!!  We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to share your recent experience with us and specifically point out a few of our amazing associates.    We will be looking forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, Great Location by the beach
Summary: This upscale hotel was well appointed and the room was clean and comfortable as one should expect. The concierge service was very poor - basically pushed the hotel restaurants and had little or no useful information on anything else and gave some incorrect leads. One should expect more from this class of hotel.   Huntington Beach is a young people's hangout and it was very noisy in the evenings and well into the next morning. There are a lot of clubs and bars close to this hotel.   We would not visit Huntington Beach as a destination again, much prefer Newport Beach down the road.
Manager Response: Dear BRIAN F,  We thank you for providing this very detailed review of our hotel based on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the compliments and high overall rating and even more so for the constructive feedback on how we can improve the experience for future guests. We are eagerly hoping to have you back as a guest in the near future so that we may exceed your expectations on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Huntington Beach
Summary: The service was above grade, I can't say enough wonderful words about all of the staff there. They were both personable and professional, they accommodated us for everything we wanted to do and suggested some things that I hadn't thought of! The spa was incredible, both inviting and relaxing.
Manager Response: Dear Thomas D,  It is very rewarding to receive such a highly rated review from you based on your recent stay.  Thank you from the entire staff!  Please come back and see us very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: My wife and I had took a weekend baby vacay before the our second child arrives. The staff and amenities at the Pasea make you feel like your the only guests in the place. Excellent food, rooms and staff. We are local to Orange County and came down to the beach for this trip and felt like we were at resort far from home. We definitely come back again. Only thing to be aware of is that there is a restaurant at Pacific City that has balcony close to the Pasea and on Friday and Saturday nights they are partying hard. Us be boring didn't really care for the loud music till 1am. Just suggesting that if your room is facing the pool and you hit the hay early, you  may want the other side of the tower.
Manager Response: Dear michaelcT9672LM,  Thank you for giving us the highest rating possible in spite of the loud music from Pacific City.  We can't thank you enough for sharing this detailed review and for sharing this with the TripAdvisor community.  We love to hear that you and your wife had a fantastic stay with us and we hope to see you back with us again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The hotel is in a great location. You can park your car at the hotel, and walk around for the rest of your stay. The beach is across the street and plenty of great restaurants so close to the hotel. The views are amazing from the view rooms. The service at the hotel was welcoming and friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Bryan M,  Wow, we love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Fantastic hotel located across from the beach in Huntington Beach. Excellent service!!! Great lobby entrance with an ocean view. Accommodating front desk staff. Tanner’s Treetop and breakfast is a must! I had an ocean view room on a high floor which was outstanding.  I definitely recommend staying here in Orange County!
Manager Response: Dear Z8176LYryanh,  Thank you for this terrific review and for staying at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted that you had such a great experience at our resort, enjoying our unbeatable location, the spectacular views from our guest rooms, and our cool California coastal vibe. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea for another stay soon!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Location was perfect, in close proximity to the beach as well as many restaurants and retail. From the valet to the front desk, the customer service was excellent. Hotel design, finishes and overall look was well thought out and absolutely beautiful. The spa was an amazing experience. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear SDNicole,  Thank you for posting this review and for giving us such a high rating.  We believe that we have the best staff in the area that deliver a personalized service for each of our guests and we're happy to hear that you agree.  We will be eagerly awaiting your next stay.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Great time with the girl friends!
Summary: On our recent trip to the Pasea Hotel and Spa we had the opportunity to enjoy the Aarna Spa. It is a beautiful relaxing environment with beautiful wood carvings, an outside garden and fountain andan indoor hot tub and sauna.It make you feel like you have be taken to some other place. We were fortunate enough to have massages from three very talented women, Masayo Anna and Hailey. They were very attentive and they went above and beyond. After as we were relaxing in the "quiet" room we received a glass of champagne.What a nice touch! The hotel is right across the street from Huntington Beach and as you sit by the pool you can see the waves crashing on the sand. The Hotel in close to everything shopping and restaurants. This was a fabulous birthday celebration and we will be back
Manager Response: Dear Carole E,  We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to sing the praises of our hotel and our Aarna Spa staff while specifically noting the efforts of Masayo, Anna and Hailey.  We love to hear that you and had a fantastic stay with us and we hope to see you back with us again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: From the time we pulled up till our departure everyone that worked there was first class. I am a GM for a BMW dealer and I am very familiar with the expectation level. I can honestly say the Pasea staff exceeded mine! I look forward to staying there again, First Class! We were there for New Years and the Rose Bowl
Manager Response: Dear maricela_velez75,  We greatly appreciate you going out of your way to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We believe our amazing staff and the service they deliver are the difference between the Paséa Hotel & Spa and the many other hotels in the area.  We are thrilled to hear that you agree and we look forward to hosting you again on your next stay in the Huntington Beach area.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Not 5 Stars Due to Food - But Wonderful Stay
Summary: Everyone that worked there was so lovely, the room was beautiful, the hotel itself beautiful, the wine was great and no one in the pool which was great for my 5 year old.  I was sold on the Jacuzzi by front clerk, but it ended up being drained when we went out to enjoy it this weekend. That was disappointing, but not a huge deal.  More disappointing was the lack of vegetarian options on the hotel menu and restaurant menu.    We had 1 vegetarian and 1 vegan and they had a vegan salad on the hotel room-service menu which lacks any creativity at all really. The restaurant had one risotto curry dish.  This was my only complaint and its a big one, honestly.  I want to bring my partner and our 2 yr old son to enjoy this place with me next time, but they are both vegan, so that's 3 of
Manager Response: Dear bl19842018,  We thank you for providing this very detailed review of our hotel based on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the compliments and high overall rating and even more so for the constructive feedback on how we can improve the experience for future guests.  We look forward to our next opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: had a fabulous time rooms were beautiful staff was very friendly from check in to check out ! the restaurant is amazing recommend you try it !! the pools are heated and towels ready when you get out ,view from Jacuzzi leads right to Huntington pier
Manager Response: Dear erick s,  Wow, we love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Staff was very polite and accommodating.  Parking was valet only.  We were a little confused at first how to get into the hotel, entrance is at the back.    Definitely a great place to get away, even if it's just for a couple days.  You will be in love and want to come back time and again.  Decor is light and airy, fresh and updated.   Each floor is a different name, elevator is speedy.   Sunset was gorgeous from this spot with beach views.  Beautiful sunrise, 80's in December is never a turn off.    Got a quick bite to eat in the evening at the restaurant, staff was wonderful, food was delicious.   Tried out the spa while the hubster was in a meeting, great great service.  Pampered, fed lunch, relaxing.  No need to leave this hotel after you check in....really.
Manager Response: Dear RoxAnnaF,  Thank you for staying at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted that you had such a great experience at our resort, enjoying our unbeatable location, the spectacular views from our guest rooms, and our cool California coastal vibe. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea for another stay soon!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The hotel was right across from the beach and great location to shopping and dining.  We didn't love the restaurant at the hotel but luckily the hotel is on a strip of many other restaurants and you don't even need to walk across the street.
Manager Response: Dear IamRS,  We greatly appreciate you going out of your way to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We enjoyed hosting you and hope you're back as our guest in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel promises so much and delivers on lots. Is World Class in certain areas BUT management? Ummm.  Thanks to the ‘extra miles’ of Brandon (receptionist), the enthusiasm and style of the car valet team and the world class Concierge this hotels gets a 4 rather then a 1 star rating.  Tanners needs a look at. Both from a service and food quality perspective. Breakfast sent out cold, evening food full of chef egos (trying to hard), drinks service very good but understaffed. With good management this eatery could be amazing. I witnessed so many customer disgruntlement whilst dining and drinking. Staff led not management driven I’m afraid. We ended up eating out most times.   The hotel is superbly kept. Views are amazing. Location excellent and the surrounding areas and
Manager Response: Dear John P,  We thank you for providing this very detailed review of our hotel based on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the compliments and high overall rating and even more so for the constructive feedback on how we can improve the experience for future guests.  We look forward to our next opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Wife and I stayed the weekend after Thanksgiving.  Hotel room was nice with great view of ocean.  Great view of sunset upon arrival.  Staff was friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  Hotel restaurant was ok- service was a little slow.  Pacific City is next door so there are a lot of dining options.
Manager Response: Dear Jim K,  We thank you for going out of your way to post this review and for rating us 4 out of 5 stars.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the delays in service at Tanner's.  We will have this matter addressed so that it is not an issue for future guests.  We hope to see you back as our guest in the near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Stayed for a one-night staycation with a large group of girlfriends and everything was perfect! Great accommodations, service, food and hospitality. And what a fabulous location ... with a yummy restaurant and bar on-site, the shopping center next door and the beach across the street! Highly recommend!!!
Manager Response: Dear hlkjx4,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your recent stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel has a perfect location.  Beachfront and close to shops and restaurants.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  They are very accommodating.  The hotel is clean, fresh and modern.  Beds are comfortable, too.  We will be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Tina R,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Whether you are a SoCal local looking for a stay-cation, or traveling from abroad, wanting to experience the best of California's surf, sun, ocean and shoreline, this is the place to be.  Situated next to the grand outdoor shopping and restaurant mall, Pacific City and located within steps of the magnificent and famous Huntington Beach and Pier, it is the perfect place to enjoy, unwind and maybe even take a surf lesson during your stay.  Hip, modern and with class, each room is tops and the hotel has it's own restaurants, bar and beautiful spa to enjoy.  Located half-way between Los Angeles and San Diego, Disneyland and Catalina Island, this is a perfect place to select to enjoy the best of what Orange County CA has to offer
Manager Response: Dear lovenycSoCal,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your recent stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I have no idea how this boutique hotel will make it in Orange County given the fact it’s buried off PCH a full 100 yards from the coast!  Were that not enough, it’s completely surrounded (read walking distance) by new upscale consumer pleasing businesses that range from clothes to 5 Star eateries. What were they thinking of locating blocks from fast foods and tee-shirt shops?  If you suffer through location and environment your left to the pleasures of hotel staff who think it their purpose in life to please.  Spacious and sparkling clean, they have taken all the pleasure out of reviewing for grumps like me. Oh, and this:  completely impossible to see the sunset over the Pacific in rooms facing east...complete blunder of design!
Manager Response: Dear BenDillow,  We greatly appreciate you going out of your way to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We enjoyed hosting you and hope you're back as our guest in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: If you love water, waves and fun in the sun, this is the hotel for you. Nice modern interiors that say - 'This is a beach resort'. Our room was a perfect base for active days on the beach - beds for very good sleep. Perfect location in Huntington Beach. Nice relaxing pool and decent gym for a good morning workout. Wonderful staff with right attitude - *Did you guys have fun?'. YES!
Manager Response: Dear anders014,  We're thrilled to hear you had a great stay and thank you for giving us the highest rating possible.  We will be looking forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Once again we were greeted by the best service from Ryan in Valet! He is the best! Brings a smile to my face every time I visit Pasea or the Pacific City. He remembers my family And Is always so nice. It’s the best part of going to the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Catherine H,  How amazing is Ryan?????  Although we're a little biased, we believe he's the best valet attendant in the area and no one delivers a personalized experience like Ryan.  Thank you for posting this review and sharing it with the TripAdvisor community.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We had a girls weekend at this hotel, had never been.  From the moment we drove in to the time we left we could not have been happier and content.  The rooms are well appointed, very comfy beds and pillows and the views are incredible.  The staff ensured our every need was met, including helping me understand the complicated light switches! Best possibly experience.
Manager Response: Dear lparker2,  We love this review!!!!!!!!!  It was an honor to host your girls weekend and we are thrilled to hear that our staff delivered another amazing experience.  We thank you for posting this and hope you're our guest again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Perfect location and facilities for a Staycation!
Summary: A friend and I recently organized a "sleepover" at the Pasea for a group of our girlfriends in lieu of our traditional holiday dinner. The location, facilities, amenities, food and most important....the service at the Pasea were exceptional. Everyone had an amazing time. It was an absolutely perfect space for this type of group event.  I worked with Marty, the Chef Concierge! She made our group feel as if we were her top priority. We all arrived in the early afternoon. Some went for a walk on the beach, some to the Spa, some to lunch, and some to shop at Pacifc City right next door (beautiful outdoor mall). In the early evening we met for a cocktail hour around a firepit at the outdoor Treehouse Lounge...and from there we went right downstairs for dinner on the patio with
Manager Response: Dear mtpcrosson,  We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to share your recent experience with us and specifically point out our amazing associate, Marty.  We're here to make your future visits special and are happy to help with any requests that make a perfect stay for you.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We stayed at Pasea for  three nights recently. We brought our two frenchies with us. From the moment we checked in to the time we checked out, everyone in the resort treated us with sincere hospitality......nothing pretentious. It is lovely to see smiling faces and staff that truly enjoys what they do. We had a room with an ocean view on the 7th floor. Very well appointed and the amenities was very nice. Had brunch at Tanners and it was delicious. Lovely surprise to come back on the first night to see a bottle of sparkling water and chocolate covered strawberries to celebrated our wedding anniversary. When in Huntington Beach, stay at Pasea. They treat you right
Manager Response: Dear alan l,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This is the best hotel you will find loaded with all amenities in Orange County. Not only is it modern and convenient but it’s accessible to Huntington Beach, tons of shopping and restaurants but it has the friendliest stay and best views of the ocean you will find. It’s right off the PCH, can’t beat location and price. It was worth my time to stay as it was recommended to me and I will continue to stay here when I return.
Manager Response: Dear brianwC9620PU,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience and we're delighted to hear that it was a great one.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Huntington Beach!   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I love this hotel. I don't think that anyone can compete with it in the area. The staff is really cool. Friendly and knowledgeable. When we went to the beach and person from the hotel gave us chairs to take to the beach. We then enjoyed the beach all afternoon with access to wifi. The same person who gave us the chairs to put out on the beach came and picked us and the chairs up when we were ready to go. The rooms are spacious. The balcony has a great view. Standards are set way high because of them. Blame them---they're great.
Manager Response: Dear Netta B,  Wow!  We love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We loved our stay! The service is great, the food is great, the location is perfect. Loved that they give you chairs towels and umbrellas to take to the beach. Our family is already talking about going back.
Manager Response: Dear JRfamily5,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience and we're delighted to hear that it was a great one.  We hope to see you and your family again on your next visit to Huntington Beach.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We usually stay at The Hilton next door, but thought we would give this new hotel a try. Valet was attentive and quick to help us get checked in.  Front desk gives was pleasant and check-in was flawless. Lived the cozy feel of the lobby and the welcoming way which led to making it a nice gathering spot. The pool, restaurant and ‘tree house’ bar are all off of the lobby.  Coffee shop and a small sundry shop are also on the lobby level. Our room faced the Hilton side and we were happy to have that quiet side of the hotel.  Nice view, although a side view, of the ocean-fog settled in, but not for long. Our room had ample room and plenty of outlets for our devices.  White wine (requested red but was told too many people spilled it on the carpet and left stains, so they went with
Manager Response: Dear 2toots,  We're sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations and thank you for your feedback.  We'll continue to work hard to deliver a better experience for our guests and hope that we may have another opportunity to host you in the future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Friendly attentive staff, well appointed rooms, excellent amenities including robes, chilled wine, bicycles and more.  Tanners restaurant very good food including breakfast and lunch. Room had beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean and surfers. Convenient central location next to shopping mall.  Highly recommend this property.
Manager Response: Dear anthonyrosemaryv,  Wow, we love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Greeted by an amazing staff, friendly, professional, and very helpful. Room 634 very well appointed with a view of the Pacific Ocean.  Gifted a bottle of wine - nice touch.  Beach bikes another plus.  Blend Cafe coffee shop and Tanner’s Restaurant ... Five ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️.   Highly Recommend!
Manager Response: Dear RozeMary,  Thank you for taking time out of your day to share your experience and we're delighted to hear that it was a great one.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to Huntington Beach.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Gorgeous hotel with a true beach vibe!  Loved the decor and extras - bottle of wine and waters In the room.  Surfer vibe - didn’t get to use the beach butler,  but the view from our beachfront balcony was sublime - had never seen flaming lanterns launched before - great!  Not many beaches let you have a fire - Huntington has 500 fire rings!  Will be back ASAP!  Near downtown and restaurants.
Manager Response: Dear Travel30728,  We thank you for rating us 4 out of 5 stars based on your recent stay with us.  We hope to host you once again on your next visit to Huntington Beach and will earn 5 out of 5 stars on that stay.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The location was nice.  Could walk to town and to beach.  Very nice rooms and there was a lot they offered.  Perfect place for a romantic vacation but the downside is that it is very pricey for the location.  It would be perfect if you were located in Hawaii but not So Cal.
Manager Response: Dear James G,  Thank you for going out of your way to post this review and share your experience during your recent stay at the Pasea Hotel & Spa.  We greatly appreciate the kind words and we’ll be working hard to earn 5 out of 5 stars from you on your next stay with us.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: High end hotel low end front desk staffs
Summary: Stayed here a couple of times.  The hotel is situated in a great location.  Rooms are clean, modern and spacious.  The pool area is very nice but the water temperature is in the chilly side.     People in the front desk....not friendly and not professional.  Compared to the many hotels I have stayed at, by fair this has to be the worst.  They don’t make you feel welcome and they always seem to be busy even if there’s no one in line.  They are inconsistent in their treatment with their guests.
Manager Response: Dear 220Musttravel,  We offer a sincere apology for the multiple challenges you incurred during your most recent stay with us.  Your feedback is vital for us to measure our performance and improve the experience for our guests.  You can rest assured that your comments will not fall on deaf ears and improvements will be made.  It is our hope that we have the opportunity to host you once again on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Stayed for a 3 day 2 night business trip. The hotel has a great location with awesome views of the beach. The pictures of the hotel are accurate and it’s a really clean and well kept place. The most memorial thing about the hotel were the valet drivers. We had about 80 of us staying and the hotel and we all left and returned at the same time so just imaging the load on these guys. Ryan was the light of my stay. Funny guy that somehow always had the car there on the spot and even though I lost my stub and had a situation where I was coming and going made things work. Customer Service like I’ve never seen from a valet. Hats off to the valet. Great set of guys. Phoenix also did a great job.  I ordered room service and the burger and fries were awesome. I will go back again when I’m
Manager Response: Dear ewill30,  We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to share your recent experience with us and specifically point out a few of our amazing associates.  We love to hear that the entire valet staff took care of you during your stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  We're hoping that your travel plans bring you back to stay with us again in the near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel has very nice rooms and they are very modern.  Many overlook the ocean which is nice until about 2AM when the bars close and the younger crowd is waiting for their taxi's or Uber's - they are VERY loud in the street which makes leaving your sliding door to the balcony noisy - other than that. Very nice hotel, staff is great the rooms are about what you would expect in an upscale area.
Manager Response: Dear mitchdsm,  We greatly appreciate you going out of your way to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We enjoyed hosting you and hope you're back as our guest in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Just completed a couples and family trip where we all stayed at the Pasea for the first few days of a longer trip.  Two couples with one child each (6 and 7 year old girls - who couldn't get enough of the pool) as well as an infant boy.  Overall quality was great, clean and bright, and they gladly put us in adjoining rooms.  The pool area and common areas are very spacious and welcoming.  The adults have all stayed in many 4-5 star hotels, both for pleasure and business, and agreed that Pasea feels like a much more upscale and service oriented hotel then one would first assume.  Beds are very comfortable and bathrooms are very sleek and have a very high end feel.  All the staff were pleasant, proactive and took care of us like their own.  The kids loved the pool, very relaxing
Manager Response: Dear DJAKATandQuinn,  Thank you for going out of your way to post this review and share your experience during your recent stay at the Pasea Hotel & Spa.  We greatly appreciate the kind words and we’ll be working hard to earn 5 out of 5 stars from you on your next stay with us.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Another amazing stay at the beautiful Pasea Hotel & Spa this past Sunday!
Summary: This is my 7th or 8th visit to the Pasea Hotel & Spa.  It is my favorite getaway hotel in the Meritage Collection!  The Front Desk staff is always pleasant and welcoming!  The Bell Desk always remembers me from my previous stay and has a friendly smile.  The room accommodations with a few of the Pacific Ocean are some of the best views I've ever stayed in.  Thank you Pasea Team for making yet another memorable stay!
Manager Response: Dear ryerye0514,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I was really looking forward to staying in this hotel after checking out its website and watching several you tube video’s. Unfortunately upon checking in, the dream of a beautiful ocean view room was dashed, when we were allocated room 221, which yes had a side view of the ocean but also had the most ugly view I have ever been given, of a rooftop full of air conditioning mushrooms ( don’t know what they are really called, check out the photograph).   I immediately called the front desk to request another room but was told that the hotel was full, and that they could see if they had any no show’s or we could change rooms the following day.  Feeling that this was not a satisfactory solution I went to guest services to complain. In all fairness the lady who I spoke with was very
Manager Response: Dear Richard H,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on your recent stay with us.  We typically deliver a great experience across the board for our guests and we sincerely apologize that this was not the case during your visit.  We'll use the feedback you've provided to review and improve our service moving forward.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again on your next visit to Huntington Beach as we promise to exceed your expectations.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel is tucked on the same strip as the big chain hotels, and I couldn't have been happier with choosing Pasea. Boutique style with large hotel feel. Cool roof-top bar set up like a tree house, sleek pool, and simple rooms. Steps to the beach and the staff will set you up with all the beach gear you need (no need to lug your own). Small balcony but enough room for a nice sit outside with wine or coffee. Complimentary bottle of wine as part of the resort fee adds a nice touch. Property is also located near some restaurants and shopping, with a short jaunt toward the pier. Recommend couples only; with kids, I recommend the Hyatt 2 doors down.
Manager Response: Dear DKMsocal,  We are grateful for such a detailed review noting some of the many positives about being a guest at the Pasea Hotel & Spa.  We promise to work hard so that we earn 5 stars on your next stay!   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights on our honeymoon. What a cool hotel! The staff was super friendly, the rooms were neat and clean, and the pool is awesome! Be sure to check our the rooftop bar - we will for sure be back!
Manager Response: Dear britty123,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your recent stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Beautiful physical property, but with some letdowns
Summary: The hotel itself is a wonderful design. Rooms are spacious, modern, contemporary, and feel light & airy.  It feels really "beachy" in keeping with its location.  The service was generally good although I felt the staff seemed young & inexperienced.  It is well located next to the new shopping/dining area, so you could reasonably stay here several days without a car and be just fine. The letdowns are these: service is a bit spotty and inexperienced, but they are trying. I was not able to correct a reservations issue (two rooms booked by company for two of us traveling together, and both somehow got in my name. After 4+ phone calls to the hotel they assured us it was fixed, however my associate still had an issue at check-in and it required a manager to resolve and allow her to
Manager Response: Dear ryans69,  We thank you for providing this very detailed review of our hotel based on your recent stay with us.  We appreciate the compliments and high overall rating and even more so for the constructive feedback on how we can improve the experience for future guests.  We look forward to our next opportunity to exceed your expectations on your next visit to Huntington Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Creepy and Pervy - Not Family Oriented
Summary: Room with 2 double-beds, in my mind, seems to signal family (parents, kids).   Oddly, there is a glass-surround shower that is open to the living area.    When a person is in the bathroom, the people in the living area can slide open a door in the living area to watch the person (full view inside the bathroom).  There is no way the person in the bathroom can protect their privacy.  Parents can watch their children shower.  Children can watch a parent shower.  Guests can watch who's ever in the shower do their thing.  Whatever - it is totally pervy.    The other oddity is that you are required to pay an extra $30/day "resort fee"  for access to the swimming pool and you are given one bottle of cheap wine (whether you want it or not).  Of course there is also a required $32/day
Manager Response: Dear TX_Traveler_2014,  We're terribly sorry that you had such a negative experience at our hotel.  We would like the opportunity to resolve this with you directly and ask that at your earliest convenience, you contact our Director of Guest Experience, Chris Kielb at:  ckielb@paseahotel.com.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Went to stay at the Pasea but due to the airshow the hotel could not accommodate us. We did have a chance to look at the rooms and found them to be well appointed with great ocean views. But the best thing about the hotel is Lindsey at the front desk. She went out of her way to help us and did it with a smile, wonderful customer service. If you are looking for a new hotel with ocean views and great customer service stay here. Thank you again Lindsey!
Manager Response: Dear Pia29,  Wow!  Thank you for this terrific review and for writing about what a wonderful job Lindsey does.  We're fortunate to have her here as one of our team members.  We hope that you come back to see us again very soon.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Definitely a young, fun vibe. We stayed in an ocean front room that was facing the pool and ocean. The pool and restaurant had great service. The hotel is right next to Pacific City so there are several shopping, food, and entertainment options nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Ashley N,  We love this review and thank you for the great comments about the hotel and the service of our staff.  We were honored to host you on this trip and hope to see you again in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: As most of you visiting the Pasea have found "PK" was the first person we came upon and I thought the rest of the stay would be as nice.  Unfortunately this could be 5 star hotel which has gone to the dogs.  Our room had dog hair on the chair iand the bed was itchy from previous canine stays.  Housekeeping did clean the chair but the bed was beyond repair.  Most hotels keep pet friendly rooms to one or two floors as guests with allergies don't mix.  We were told that pets have the run of the hotel.  I get the feeling that this is a new establishment trying to get its sea legs, fresh management is needed to raise the bar to match the rates charged.  We are locals and should have taken an Uber as the parking fee is San Franciscoish at $35 / night and the "resort" fee is $25.  No
Manager Response: Dear g m,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on your  stay with us.  We'll use the feedback you've provided to review and improve moving forward.  We typically deliver a great experience across the board for our guests and we sincerely apologize that we failed to prevent this experience from negatively impacting your stay.  We hope that we may have another opportunity to host you in the future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Loved everything. Great location, nice get away spot since you can spend the whole time in the area without a car. So many options for restaurants and bars since Pacific city is right next door.  Maybe even get some shopping in or go across the street to the beach.
Manager Response: Dear Steve K,  We're thrilled to hear you had a great stay and thank you for giving us the highest rating possible.  We will be looking forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This place has so much going for it -- a great location (right on Pacific Coast Hwy), beautiful rooms, a really nice pool area, shops & restaurants next door, chic & trendy decor.  If you get an oceanview room the sight from your balcony is glorious.  Beds are wonderful, & the staff is helpful.  Just be aware of the price -- it's expensive, parking is extra (& also expensive), no food is included.  We enjoyed our stay very much, but was it worth the cost?  Yes, maybe for that 1 night that you feel like splurging.  But there are some choices nearby that will save you HUNDREDS of dollars (for 1 night) & are still very nice.  It was a wonderful way to end our vacation, but we could have started our next getaway fund with $$ saved by staying somewhere a tad less pretentious.
Manager Response: Dear dancemore,  Thank you for staying at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted that you had such a great experience at our resort, enjoying our unbeatable location, the spectacular views from our guest rooms, and our cool California coastal vibe. Thank you for sharing this review and voicing your concern of our pricing.  Our goal is not to trick or hide these costs from our guests, but offer competitive pricing in the area.  If you would like to discuss this further, please contact Chris K., Director of Guest Experience directly at:  714-698-6108.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea for another stay soon!  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This hotel is Beautiful and has great views however it would never make up for the total lack of service! The entire hotel seems to have a an attitude of indifference towards its guests, this must stem from a lack of hospitality training. My company, my clients, and I will never come here again.  We have hosted events here, stayed here, and this past weekend brought our clients to the bar for a drink, this last visit was the final straw that broke the camels back and the reason for my review. The bar staff treated our group very badly, she literally said she didn't have time to serve us, we wrote our own list of drinks and had to serve them ourselves and she had a rude attitude on top of it, their security allowed a very drunk guest to continually harass the female guests in our
Manager Response: Dear Dre726,  We thank you for sharing your experience and sincerely apologize that we did not exceed your expectations.  We would like the opportunity to get more detailed information from you.  When it's convenient, please contact Chris Kielb, Director of Guest Experience at:  ckielb@paseahotel.com or 714-698-6108.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Pasea is beautiful, clean and well finished. Our room was bright, airy and extremely comfortable. I could not recommend it more. It is a perfect location to shops and restaurants. The view we had of Huntington Beach and the Pacific was breathtaking. We loved our stay and would return.  Charges. The $35 a night service charge is a big hit and must consider when booking as it will be added on. Valet is $30 a night if you have a car which can also sting. Worth if you are travelling around though.
Manager Response: Dear Nick R,  We're thrilled to hear you had a great stay and thank you for giving us the highest rating possible.  We will be looking forward to your next visit to Huntington Beach so that we may host you once again.   Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: A very nice hotel with lovely rooms.  Beautiful location and very handy to Pacific City.  They do have the slowest housekeeping on the planet :)  The pool gets over crowded and half the seats are "reserved" for people who never seem to come.  Also make sure they give you the wrist bands for the pool when you check in... Not sure we would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear NiknakNZ,  We thank you for going out of your way to post this review and for rating us 4 out of 5 stars.  Please accept our sincere apologies for the delays in housekeeping.  Furthermore, we're sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations at the pool. Thank you for your feedback.  We will have these matters addressed so that it is not an issue for future guests.  We hope to see you back as our guest in the near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The Pasea is a reasonable choice at the beach in Orange county. The rooms are modern and comfortable. Uber and Lyft have trouble Finding the entrance which is not on PCH and is not indicated as you approach the building. Staff is friendly but not generally effective. I am still waiting for my emailed folio as well as response to my email rerequesting it. If the Pasea wants to compete in the luxury hotel space they are going to need to up their game.
Manager Response: Dear Atlrich,  We're sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations and thank you for your feedback.  We'll continue to work hard to deliver a better experience for our guests and hope that we may have another opportunity to host you in the future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: After traveling to So Cal for several years for work I decided to stay at Pasea for the first time this past April and was VERY pleased. In fact, Ive now stayed the past 4 visits because it's become one of my favorite hotels in So Cal.  The hotel is modern and located in a great area. It sits next to Pacific City which is loaded with different restaurants, bars and shopping. So there's plenty of food options and things to do at night without having to take an uber or use a car.   My favorite part about Pasea, other than the modern feel and location, is the treetop roof bar located on top of Tanners Restaurant at the hotel. Great place for happy hour, or to catch up on emails after a long day.
Manager Response: Dear Jeremy L,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.    Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Great location near the beach.  Average facility.  Very small swim pool.    Terrible beverage and food service.  20 minute waits for drinks and 45 to get into the half empty restaurants.  The day after the holiday we were told by our pool waiter at 3pm that that "they are sending me home."  We could get our own food and drinks at the bar.  That's the reason.    My wife fell over a pile of towels in one of  the small pool walkways.  The manager asked if we were OK.  No offer of help or even a complementary drink.  I suggested he have the towel guys clean up the towels.  He walked right passed them on his way into the lobby and didn't say a word.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on your recent stay with us.  We typically deliver a great experience across the board for our guests and we sincerely apologize that this was not the case during your visit.  We'll use the feedback you've provided to review and improve our service moving forward.  We hope to have the opportunity to host you again on your next visit to Huntington Beach as we promise to exceed your expectations.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Resort/Spa in Hungtington Beach
Summary: Excellent location and amenities, friendly staff and very clean and comfortable hotel. Hotel is referred to as a resort/spa since the hotel is a one stop visit for all your needs with restaurants, pool and bars located within the hotel. Great view of the beach and close to downtown hot spots within a two block walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.

Summary: We arrived from Napa valley having driven 12 hours to be met with the best reception and service of our 6 stop honeymoon tour of Cali.  The hotel is beautiful, the pool clean and well catered.  All staff from the bellman to the valet to the bar staff were keen to help and thoroughly genuine.  The only downside is the added costs: $35 + tax per night for parking $30 + tax per day to use the pool and for wifi Overall I'd have no hesitation in recommending this place and would love to visit again.
Manager Response: We were honored to receive such an outstanding review based on your stay with us at the the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  We will continue to deliver memorable experiences for our guests and we hope that includes you again in the near future.

Summary: We cannot say enough about The Blue at The Pasea Hotel.  Such a beautiful space for a meeting.  The catering staff is extremely helpful and great to work with. They are super friendly and very accommodating.  We look forward to hosting future events at this location.
Manager Response: We love this review and thank you for the great comments.....we're delighted that you had this experience and also sang the praises of our banquet team.  We are eagerly anticipating your next event with us!

Summary: I was told by a friend about Pasea and I was not disappointed.  The facility is only a year or so old so everything is new.  The concierge staff were amazing and they did everything to make my stay more pleasurable.  They provided a complimentary bottle of wine for my room.  I was able to upgrade to a beachfront room on the top floor for minimal cost.  The hotel provided free use of a bicycle and beach chairs and towels for the beach.  Flat screen television and a refrigerator in the room were nice perks.  Onsite restaurant and bars were excellent.  Check out the tree house bar upstairs.   All of this, with outstanding beach views.
Manager Response: Wow, we love to read reviews like this as your experience is what we work hard to deliver for our guests each day.  Thank you for the kind words and we look forward to your next visit to the Paséa Hotel & Spa.

Summary: Our groups of discerning Travel industry professionals were very impressed with the new Pasea Hotel and Spa.   We enjoyed superb drinks and Incredible ocean views from the upstairs deck of Tanners Bar and Grill.   Our banquet food and service were outstanding! The ocean views from the ballroom were equally stunning.   I plans monthly meetings and this is a very special venue.  Christine Dingman in sales was a pleasure to work with. Highly professional and could not do enough for us.  Jeff Catubig and his banquet service staff performed flawlessly.
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for going out of your way to share your recent experience with us and specifically point out a few of our amazing associates.  We're hoping that your travel plans bring you back to stay with us again in the near future.

Summary: We spent the best weekend in 4 years since we moved to the US.  Location is great, Staff were super friendly and Hotel is very clean and beautiful. Definitely will stay there again and again. we really had a very good time there.
Manager Response: Dear AmirGhabrous,  Thank you for taking the time to post this review and for all of the kind sentiments about your stay at the Paséa Hotel & Spa.  Your recommendation to the TripAdvisor audience means a great deal to us and we will eagerly await your next visit.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We enjoyed our stay, we were there for the Labor Day weekend. Hotel is at a great location walking distance to the beach, offering free bike rentals as well as a beach butler to take you to the beach, which was great when traveling with a child you don't have to carry beach chairs, towels, stroller...etc, they also have buckets and toys for the kids to play with .. hotel is walking distance to shopping and restaurants as well as the Pier! it's right next to pacific shopping center which was also a plus! Only downfall was that our room didn't get serviced, we called to ask why there was no room service, we were told that they were busy and housekeeping didn't get around to all the rooms, to prevent that from happening i believe more help should be hired.  Also the room was nice,
Manager Response: Dear WojtekM3,  We greatly appreciate you going out of your way to share your experience with the TripAdvisor community.  We enjoyed hosting you and your family and hope you're back as our guest in the very near future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: This Hotel has so many pluses:  Location, Pool, Beach Front, Grand Space, Beachy meets High end Vibe, etc.  But there is just something missing.  I have been all over the world and stayed in many types of accommodations (economy hut to grand elegance) and I have found that one of the most important things is how I am treated by the staff.  I am not a demanding person and I genuinely like people.  At the Pasea I felt like the staff was walking on egg shells, being watched and a sense of nervousness of meeting expectations that took away from the "genuineness" that I look for.  Don't get me wrong, no one was outright rude to me or anything like that.  I just didn't like the energy.  Maybe the staff has to deal with those same people that cut me off in traffic all the time and I am
Manager Response: Dear N2travels,  We're sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations and thank you for your feedback.  We'll continue to work hard to deliver a better experience for our guests and hope that we may have another opportunity to host you in the future.  Warmest Regards,  Joe Leinacker General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I just stayed there this last weekend for our second time in one year.... My favorite thing about this hotel is the POOL! it overlooks PCH and the beach SO BEAUTIFUL! Also they let you use bikes, towels, beach toys, umbrellas...they will give you a ride to the beach on a bike taxi if requested..... the downside to this place is of course it is EXPENSIVE! but it seems to be worth it every time so far!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend. We were in the O.C. for a baby shower (we live in Santa Monica) and decided to make a weekend of it by staying here. I'm not a huge fan of big resorts (I tend to go for smaller boutique hotels), so I was truly pleasantly surprised by this place.   THE LOCATION & PROPERTY The entire property is really beautiful, from the lobby to the lounges to the pool area. Keep in mind it's in across the (busy) street from Huntington Beach and amidst a brand-new shopping complex, which means you're not going to get a tropical or secluded beach vacation. I think most people who go to this area realize this, but I feel like that's the one caveat. SO. Based on that, this place is great. Huntington is just so chill, even compared to Santa Monica. And
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you want a fabulous place to stay on Huntington Beach the Pasea is for you!  It is only a year old.  It's hard to beat brand new with beautiful décor. We requested a quiet room that was on a low floor when making the reservation.  While waiting for our room to be cleaned we were allowed to wait in room 426.  You can see the sunset over the pier.  Our family voted to stay in this room overlooking the pool and ocean/pier.  You could hear music from the pool and bar when outside on the balcony.  When you closed the patio doors it was quiet in the room, excellent sound proofing.  We never heard any noise from other rooms or people walking by in the halls. The staff is very helpful and friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: AWESOME but watch out for all the extra fees!
Summary: Yes, it's expensive. We decided to splurge and it was so awesome. The decor is beautiful, you could just sit in the lobby and be happy. The pool is excellent, warm, but too warm, and the seating is not overcrowded. We didn't' eat at the restaurant, but it smelled wonderful. A coffee bar in the lobby! The only thing I'd tell you is that there are A LOT of hidden fees. When we looked at the original price was $298...in the end with all the fees it was $383 a night! There is resort fee and parking fee and a bunch of special taxes! That is kind of ridiculous to add those fees without telling us. We only stayed 2 nights and honestly after staying at budget style rooms the week before I was still ok with the price (My husband was NOT!), In the end, I'd say it is a lovely place. They
Manager Response: none

Summary: If it were not for the incredibly nice staff members this place may go down to a two star.  First of all the place is clean and real nice. The rooms are nice and the location is the best in the whole area.  It I right next to all the shops and restaurant and right across from the beach.  We were excited to get there.  The issues are that there is a wait for everything.  When we arrived we waited in line to find out  our room was not ready so we went to eat which was not a problem.  Then when we were called late in the afternoon and told it was finally ready we were made to wait in a fifteen minute line just to get our keys. There were multiple people working up front but not all taking care of guests.  There was no apology for the wait or effort to make things better.  Finally a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here when it just a couple of months after opening. Had booked a really nice corner suite, though expensive. Club like atmosphere around the (crowded) pool and great - not too overpriced - drinks. Food was just average. And here is the negative side: If you decide to go to the beach, hotel staff straps a backpack-like beachchair on your back, hands over an umbrella and towels, and orders you to march to the beach, just as if you were an applicant for the US Marines or something... If I pay that much in a hotel room, I expect to be welcomed by a "hotel area" at the beach, which provides me with beach beds, umbrellas, towels, bottled water, maybe a whole Bar / Oceanfront Grill. Instead, there is zero service at the beach. As I mentioned, this is a hip place, not the Pelican
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great new resort in Orange Co!
Summary: The Pasea is located in Huntington Beach with only a road between it and the surf! Wonderful views with a great laid back coastsl vibe. Nice modern touches are found throughout the hotel. Staff is nice but don't expect upscale service. We rented the penthouse which is quite pricey but worth it for a celebration or splurge.  Very nice shopping right next door and plenty of casual restaurants
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Pasea Hotel and Spa in Huntington Beach is a very nice Hotel! A bit pricy but a beautiful place. Close to the bar he and downtown. If you got some spare cash the view is worth it. The view of the pier is amazing. The picture shows the Sunset with the pier in the background.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stayed almost 3 weeks here, great location, clean, nice facilities!
Summary: We stayed here for almost 3 weeks, rooms were lovely and tidy.  Staff are friendly, Ryan from Valet is a star.  He made our stay so much more enjoyable and just so friendly.  My two children will miss Ryan!   We would highly recommend this hotel.  Nice and new.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to have fun and relax
Summary: Beautiful new beach hotel, restaurant, and bar! And we tried them all! They also have a spa but just ran out of time. Our room had a beautiful view of Huntington Beach and was decorated with a bright beach feel . It even offers a small balcony! The bathroom amenities were the Fresh brand which are beautiful. The pool area offered plenty of lounges and towel service with bar/snack service offered at your chair.  We had the bed/breakfast package so we also tried the restaurant.  It was delicious and creative so it pleased the whole family. In the evening we walked next door to The Pacific City Center which offered all kinds of restaurant options and some fun retail shops as well. The next day we took advantage of the beach concierge service - they supplied beach chairs (with
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is a relatively new hotel. The decor is very bright and pleasing to the eye. Location is also very good with easy access to the beach. The bill will get padded up with a resort fee which I suspect all hotels do in this area. I attended a wedding here and the arrangements were top notch. The rooms are well laid out and had very contemporary decor. Room service is slow and quality of food is mediocre at best. The beds are an issue, the mattress is thin and pillows are uncomfortable. If your sleep is not being helped along with alcohol you will not get a restful nights sleep, Front desk personnel are probably still trainees as the hotel is new. I did not find them helpful in resolving a billing issue.They eventually caved it and I got the marriage rate that everybody had gotten
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very overpriced and overrated...the rooms and overall atmosphere were nice however the hotel lacks in service.   You pay top dollar yet the service is that of a lesser property - a couple of things to note...lots of young servers at the pool hanging around the bar not paying attention to their customers, the pool was left w used towels on chairs, food on tables for hours as no one was keeping on top of it..apparently they sell day passes to local families which was a huge turnoff as the pool was filled w kids jumping, splashing and not respecting the guests.    Lobby bar closed at 10 and they tried to push us into an upstairs lounge that was not our cup of tea.  they did this to several non 20s and lost that business
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, but be aware of a few things...
Summary: Recently stayed for two nights and was thoroughly impressed, but there are some important things to note.  Overall, I did not experience what some reviewers negatively commented on regarding noise, but I was staying Monday through to Wednesday and the surf finals had just completed.  PROS: - Great staff and service from PK taking our luggage and showing us the room to Felicia and her team helping us with anything and everything we had an issue on. Morgan was also helpful in the pool area. - Location is amazing with the mall next door and beach right across the street - Beautiful lobby and pool area - Fast elevators - Housekeeping very pleasant and helpful - Beach chairs and umbrellas were very handy - Ocean front room was wonderful  CONS: - As noted with another reviewer, the
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love everything about this hotel except tile by the pool area is very slippery. Saw several kids & adults fall. The rooms are beautiful with very comfortable beds. Tanners a little pricey but food was excellent! Customer service was fantastic everywhere we went in the hotel. Very refreshing! Usually stay at he Hyatt Huntington Beach which is also very nice but like the smaller, more intimate feel of the Pasea! Would definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked one night here before leaving town because we have wanted to stay since it opened. Reservation was for King OceanFront and we were assigned room 438, although it was not ready upon arrival at 1 pm.  We stored our bags and went to the bar in the hotel for lunch and drinks.  It was quickly apparent that this bar was understaffed. One bartender was managing drinks for 14 people sitting at his bar, people dining in adjacent restaurant and patio as well as three servers requesting drinks for the packed pool.  It's Summer, it's Sunday and the closing day of the Open across the street. One bartender? Really? Service was slow as expected. We ordered a cheeseburger and lettuce wraps.  After 35 minutes I asked if he could check on our food. He said it looks likes it just came up.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We visited Huntingbeach and booked a room for our family of five at the Hyatt Resort. Kids are 18, 15 and 12. Upon arrival at the Hyatt, we were disappointed and it just went downhill from there. Friends told us about the Pasea so we walked just down the street to look at it. Wow. The Pasea is the kind of hotel that is a vacation in itself if you want an experience. Really modern, open and chic. Definitely ideal for families with teenage children and older or couples. This is not a place for small children. Staff is truly kind and accomodating. Rooms are simply just cool. We stayed in room with wrap around balcony and views of the beach are amazing. Yes, you are right on the street but that is part of the excitement. We slept great even with the traffic going by. Great black out
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wow! Had an amazing weekend at Pasea. From the people to the view our stay was perfect. Every worker was very friendly and went out of there way to make sure we were happy and comfortable. Excellent location, food and nice shopping center right next door. Pool atmosphere doesn't get much better. you can be swimming while looking out at the ocean. We were only supposed to stay 1 night but had to extend our stay. We will Definitely be back! my new favorite hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is not a family establishment. I stayed here for a conference and paid for two rooms because we have three children. This was a mistake! It was over $800/ night with our discounted rate. We requested adjoining rooms when we reserved the dates and upon arrival found out we had been placed on two different floors. This was resolved by placing us in adjacent rooms after several minutes of negotiation at the front desk. We requested towels on one occasion, no housekeeping or linen changes and was still charged a daily resort fee for BOTH rooms. We never once used the pool or spa or pool because they were tiny and cram packed. In fact, we left the resort all together each day we were there. To top it all of we laid awake all night because of all of the partying and loud
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's only two years old. On the beach. Next to a small outdoor mall. Great location for shopping (Huntingdon centre is two blocks away).  The staff are really helpful. Water available whenever you want. The pool is immense with great views of the beach (especially when you are in the hot tub) The only draw back is the valet parking which is costly. Apart from that - it is Proof that you get what you pay for.  Will definitely go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean, bright and airy. The view from our room was incredible, the pacific ocean was just across the street. Pretty cool TV system, it let me cast my Netflix from my phone onto the TV as if I was at home! After a week long stay, I can say the beds are very comfortable. The staff was friendly from the moment we walked in until they helped us pack our car. The highlight of our stay might have been the beach butler service where we were escorted a short walk across PCH to the beach. The butlers setup a umbrella and left us with plenty of chairs and towels and then returned to collect them when we were ready to come back! I took advantage of the beach yoga two mornings and I recommend it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: amazing new oasis by the beach
Summary: Perfect location, multiple amenities and awesome staff.  Got upgraded to full ocean view without extra fee.  Location next to a wonderful shopping mall, across the Pacific Coast highway from a huge beach and can't say enough about how wonderful it was.  Definitely coming back year after year.  Great restaraunt and coffee shop.  Wonderful rooms and comfortable bed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Here for a Disneyland trip with my family and decided to stay here near my friend who lives in HB. She said it's a new hotel with ocean views so we figured instead of the busy Disney area we should drive a little and get a nicer place that's relaxing. Boy did we make a mistake. Let me tell you about the pros and cons of this place...  Pros:  -If you're here for the nightlife and don't care about noise then this is the place for you.  -If you want to be close to a beach and don't care about noise then again, this is the place for you.  -Staff is friendly  -Room service is great  -Shopping and restaurants and beach are all very close   Cons: -Very noisy hotel especially on weekends. Nightlife music doesn't stop till 2 AM so be prepared.  -Noisy hotel on the inside also. Doors are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Checking it out for a wedding
