Summary: Amazing staff. Loved the view. Staff went out of the way to help the guests. Rooms were awesome. TANNERS restaurant is AMAZING !! we tried all veggie dishes. Were all great. Their service was so good and so was the ambience
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Pasea pool and Spa for 2 days and one night. I highly recommend it, you won't be disappointed  Top notch customer service Poolside with Ocean front views Beautiful hotel and spa Relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a hotel!! Everything was amazing! The staff was very nice and friendly, the amenities were spectacular. The room was modern and fantastic! It was a great surprise for our honeymoon!!! I loved it!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is the BEST BEACH HOTEL in California
Summary: I stayed here for two nights.  The staff was awesome.  The location is perfect.  The pool and bar are upscale chic but not pretentious in any way.  They have a Tesla charger in the valet garage.  They have a concierge that helps set up your beach stuff.  Wonderful food and shopping is a short walk away.  I loved the view and the rooms.  They aren't huge, but why stay in the room when you have a wonderful beach scene and pool scene directly in front of you.  I would stay here again just to experience the California Beach scene one more time.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel, Highly Priced, Poorly Staffed
Summary: This was my annual big time stay in a nice hotel. First of all I really enjoyed the hotel itself abd the amenities. If you get the sea side view its beautiful.  Now the bad part. They overcharged me close $200 and I had to ask them to return it a week after I left Huntington Beach. This was terrible mismanagement by the front staff not being up front or due dilligent. The manager in charge of renting out bikes was very iffy and said no initially to rent out a beach bike for me because there was an hour left to return the beach bikes! She was plain rude, but eventually couped in. They charged me an arm and a leg on everything. The in room meal service is extremely expensive. Summary: Stayed two nights in double queen room with ocean view, located above pool area.   Room was fairly large, classy, clean, felt modern and comfortable. The hotel has a decent size pool, a kiddie pool (that was more or less constantly occupied by adults for some reason) and a 7" deep pool with some sun beds in it.  Not sure what that's about. Cooling down, probably.   Hotel staff were very easy going and helpful, and provided beach chairs, towels and toys for our kids when we went across the street to the beach.   The only negative I can think of is that the pool area was quite noisy a few hours every evening (party). Not a big deal for us, but if you are a light sleeper and like to go to bed early, maybe consider asking for a room a little further from the pool.

Jacuzzi pool has view of beach and pier as well as pool. Restaurant "Tanners" has great breakfasts and drinks are "ok". Best to buy wine by the bottle for best value. You get a bottle of wine with room. Spa is wonderful and only 25 bucks a day. Massages and other services extra but you get use of sauna,steam room, and jacuzzi as well as unlimited iced tea and water, relax room or outdoor garden area. We were there over Easter weekend and there were so many kids. The pool side service was also terrible- not enough waiters. You were better off walking up and ordering yourself.

Summary: So awesome. Vegas style hotel with connected shops and restaurants on the beach. Surfing instead of slots. Good for families or couples. It might be a bit expensive but worth it to not stay at some of the other over priced dives in HB. Fun pool. Hottest hot tub around for after your surf.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful hotel and spa with a fantastic location and Surf City is a great place to visit.  Walking distance to Pacific City, great local restaurants, main street shopping, and the Huntington Beach pier.  Aileen Robinson and the staff were very helpful.  One night just isn't enough to appreciate all this venue has to offer. We plan on booking another stay soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for 1 night during our spring break vacay in southern california; previous to this we were at Monarch Beach.  Loved the location because it was right across from the beach and many shops/restaurants.  However the customer service was very disappointing-from front desk to valet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: With a cohesively upmarket, relaxed and beachy vibe throughout, Paséa is perfectly positioned to exploit its golden beachfront location and provide a high-quality, recharging retreat.  Sometimes we enjoyed super-friendly, responsive, even anticipatory service throughout the venue that rewarded our decision to book this enticing-looking facility and enjoy its amazing location.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the rule. Management has prioritised a party venue approach and allowed its level of service degrade to that level of expectation. While many staff throughout were super attentive and responsive, inconsistency was the prevailing climate. Front desk was reachable maybe 30% of the time, room service was a bit interpretive in what was replaced, valet pickup location switched

Summary: A new place on PCH with a fun vibe, a spa and probably the most helpful staff I have seen in quite some time.  Great location if you are doing Huntington Beach.  A pleasant surprise was the 4 PM complementary wine and cheese tasting in the lobby (good wine too) the energy was great and it is obvious that the locals love this place.  Full of energy and relaxing all at the same time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for one night after a wedding. The hotel opened not too long ago so is very spick and span. The rooms are nice with a personal balcony that overlooks the pool, bar, and restaurant. Be forewarned that there is a highway that separates the hotel from the beach, so it is not beachfront. But, it is a 2 minute walk to the beach. Will likely spend a weekend get away here soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay here frequently for business and it feels like my home away from home. I wish I had a bed and pillows as comfortable as in the room. The staff are amazing and have helped me with a host of random requests over the last couple of months, including bandaging me up when I had a fall running on the beach. It is my favorite place to stay and I highly recommend to anyone for personal or business. It is located adjacent to the mall with a lot of restaurants and shops that are easily accessible, as well as being right on the beach, perfect for a morning run or sunset stroll. Housekeeping goes above and beyond, room service is great, and the front desk has always been super friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great attention to detail! Staff goes above and beyond
Summary: I enjoyed the in-room perks. Coffee, Water and wine plus great wifi so I didn't leave the room for days. I KID but not about the perks.  Entire staff...every employee really goes out of the way to provide excellent service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Pasea for 4 nights in April and had a blast. The hotel is beautiful. Everything was well thought out when they built this hotel and it shows. The staff is amazing. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, from valet, to the check in staff, concierge, room service and housekeeping.  The rooms are beautiful and well designed. The pool was very fun with good music and wonderful views of the beach and ocean. Beach chairs, towels and umbrellas are available for daily use at the beach. The hotel is a combination of elegant and casual with a great vibe - no stuffiness. Again enough cannot be said about the wonderful staff.  Shout out to Nicholas with room service who went out of his way to arrange some soup broth with crackers (not on the menu) for my daughter when she
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 1 week and didn't want to leave.  The staff was amazing.  Beautiful decor throughout the hotel.  Rooms were very clean and spacious.  Make sure to get an ocean view room, itʻs worth the extra money.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fun, casual, and elegant hotel right on the beach
Summary: I stayed here recently on business for two nights.  Working mostly from my hotel room, I had a chance to get a good feel for this hotel.  It's new, and it's a gem.  First, everyone one at the hotel is very friendly and open.  They genuinely seemed to want to help at every turn.  I got to know some of the staff on a first-name basis: Lydia in the exceptional Blend coffeeshop, Jamie at the front desk, and Matt in Tanner's Restaurant.  Every one of these staff members did a little extra to make my stay more comfortable.  If I had to describe this hotel, I would classify it as "casual elegance".  It's clearly a 4 or 5 star hotel, but without the stuffiness.  It's a nice feel.  As an example, flip flops were left in the room for me to use for a walk along the beach.  A thoughtful
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything about this hotel is A+, From the moment you walk into the door you are greeted by friendly,  knowledgeable staff. At check-in they were able to give us a very nice room location along with a glass of champagne. They have a complimentary wine and champagne  in the afternoon. Scott,  The general manager of the hotel spoke with this at length and was so interesting. He was greeting people around the wine bar.  We spent some time poolside which was wonderful. The rooftop bar and restaurant in Tanners is so beautiful and so much fun.  We spent the evening in the adjacent mall where there are many places for food and drink. It was a wonderful one night staycation – we will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First impressions go a long way
Summary: Stayed 3 nights, visiting family in HB. After dropping copious sums of money on rooms, poolside drinks, and dinners, I went to the desk to reserve a cabana for the following day. All were available, for $300. I was repeatedly and pedantically informed that the pool is 'impacted' so my local sister and her husband would be 'allowed' to join us. Pasea tries to be high-end, but a lot of low-brow details turned us off. If you have local friends/family, stay at the Hyatt or Hilton where they (and their $$$) will be welcome and professionalism is consistent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We went with a beach front room for the view. We were on the 6th floor. The view was beautiful but you will pay for it. It comes with a bottle of wine, some flip flops and that's about it. The room was nice, you can shower looking right out at the ocean. You'll get hit with parking fees, resort fees, beach fees, and any other fees they can think of. It was nice but I feel we only paid for the view, I've stayed in better rooms before.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Will always remember our little family getaway here. Steps away from beautiful Huntington Beach and the awesome Pacifica restaurants and shops.   Beautiful artwork/decor at every corner and thoughtful amenities in the room and hotel. They had complimentary cheese and wine in the lobby each afternoon we were there served by smiling staffers. They had free to rent beach towels and beach toys for the kids. Cool cafe, spa, pool, bar/restaurant.   Maybe a more trendy upscale than casual luxury, and maybe structurally more of a Hilton hotel... they manage to live up to a resort stay in feel. Family left completely relaxed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked last minute last evening! Beautiful property and gracious from the moment you walk in. Clean, complimentary flip flops, wine, robe, water bottles. You don't see this kind of hospitality without a "catch". Free bikes...pool is beautiful as well. I live within 15 miles and will most certainly book for a staycation!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is an excellent location, right on PCH, but beware....$30 a night resort fee. Pulled up to valet parking.........$35 a day. Asked valet where public parking was, he advised me it was across the street, but it was the same price. My room was at the back part of the hotel, only problem is that there is heavy construction going on there. At 7 am, constant beep beep beep, from loaders, cranes and other heavy equipment. Small shop with amenities, soda, chips, etc. closed very early. I would not stay @ any Hotel along PCH. Go inland a mile or so and save big bucks. Also staff here was not the best, very indifferent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I drove out to Huntington Beach to attend the Golfers Against Cancer Event at the Sea Cliff Golf Course. The Organizer was able to block some rooms at this lovely hotel.  We booked late and though we received the discounted rate, we were put in a handicap room with a partial ocean view. I don't know what is is lately but I have been receiving handicap rooms.  At this hotel a handicap room has a large tub with a safety seat in it. After trying to change the room we just stayed put. My husband removed the safety seat for our stay. But we found  the tub incredibly slippery. After my shower, I complained to the manager and later that afternoon a tub mat was brought to our room. The only other complaint I would make about the bathroom is that the towels were stored by
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT STAYING HERE FOR A SPECIAL OCCASION- DON'T!!!!
Summary: IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT STAYING HERE FOR A SPECIAL OCCASION- DON'T!!!!  I stayed here for my wedding night with my husband. We live in HB so we thought this would be a perfect new place to start an anniversary tradition. I thought it would be incredibly special and we would have a one of a kind memorable experience. The front desk staff was the worst- when checking in, i asked if we could have a room with a bathtub because i am pregnant and wanted to enjoy a soak because I can't go in the jacuzzi. The receptionist told me she could DOWNGRADE our ocean view room if we really wanted a bath tub. We said no thanks, we would rather have a great view. I was not expecting an upgrade, but really i've been accommodated better at Marriots and other average priced hotels, and it wasn't

Summary: We just got married here and had the best wedding weekend! The service was great! Ryan in valet and the bellmen Peter and Matt were the best we have ever had! They all knew our names, were so helpful, and made us feel special! They helped make it a great weekend for us and our guests!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent three days at this luxurious spa hotel. Rooms were very modern and bright. Service was top notch. Especially David and Chelsea at the pool area and Jesse who helped with the bikes. Definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Oceanfront room is different from the oceanfront rooms on the east coast. More like Road front looking at RV park..  The hotel was beautiful. Staff was great. I went to a short dinner and when I returned to hotel wanted a cup of coffee but the woman behind the coffee counter said she was closing. It was still early evening. The rooms very noisy. Too bad it was foggy and I could not view the ocean from my balcony. I did not get a final bill. Waited on an email with bill which I never got. One night stay in a regular oceanfront room cost me $429.00.Not quite worth it. I had just moved from a 2BR 2 full Bath, Kitchen, washer & Dryer, living room, balcony villa by Marriott because I thought I was getting a cheaper room. Nice place but look for cost added to room cost.

Summary Heading: All you need for a successful business meeting
Summary: This new resort (opened in June 2016) provides a relaxing, satisfying setting to connect with colleagues while providing many entertainment options. Connected to a high-end specialty food court and tasteful mall, there are opportunities for delicious dining and specialty shopping. This location has a lush, bright, and welcoming lobby with plenty of room to chat with colleagues. Location also provides places for quiet reflection. Rooms are spectacular - with high quality  furniture and fixtures, mood lighting, and noise isolation. The balcony with the beach view wasn't bad either. Highly recommended for business or leisure travelers alike.

Summary: I was really looking forward to a special quick getaway and was a little disappointed.   Only stayed one night and we stayed in an oceanfront room.  What I didn't expect was that I was going to be overlooking a freeway and then RVs across the street.  I own an RV so I could have stayed right next to the sand for 1/5 of what this room cost.  Yes, it is a beautiful hotel, it has the convenience of being right next to a shopping area and it has a hip vibe but I think it is overpriced.  The room we got was small but nicely decorated. There is a frosted glass door that opens into the toilet area - I would have personally preferred a solid door.  I found the night stand dirty - it had what looked like melted ice cream on it.  I am a germ freak so as soon as I saw that - I felt like
Manager Response: Thank you for coming to visit us and your business is much appreciated. We are sorry that to hear of your experience regarding the rooms cleanliness. This is not to our standard and we hold ourselves accountable to maintain our Luxury environment. We are happy you could enjoy Tanners and we always appreciate hearing that our staff is friendly and polite. We will share the kudos with the team. Our goal is to aim to please and would love the opportunity to welcome you back.

Summary: My husband, two daughters and I spent a three nights in Huntington Beach to recover from a busy visit to Disneyland. Having never visited HB before, I was torn between the descriptions of the Pasea and the Shorebreak. We chose the Pasea because it had a pool. Once we arrived at the Pasea, I knew we had made the right choice.  The Pasea overlooks the beach and yes, the PCH, does stand between you and the beach, but the PCH stands between all the other big name hotels and the beach. The beach is just a short walk away. The other good thing about the location is that it is a short walk from downtown HB so you can easily experience "Surf City USA" without having to listen to a lot of noise at night.  The staff were super friendly. The hotel and all its areas (lobby, rooms, and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Pasea Hotel for your Disneyland recovery stay. We are happy you could make it out to Huntington Beach, and even more happy you chose us to make your trip even better. We are proud that our staff could provide a fantastic experience, and your positive feedback will be shared with every department. Hopefully you can come back and join us next time you and your family decides to escape the snow.

Summary: There is so much to like about this hotel from the exceptional service to the thoughtful design. The beach theme is pervasive and charming. The interior design of everything is effortless. Bath accessories are lovely. A standup shower is a mandatory for me and it's about perfect here. Room service and restaurant food was good. It doesn't blow me away but it's suitable. Great location. Clean, modern design - clearly I'm enamored with the design.  The only reason I didn't give five stars is because of the toilet room door. The door only opens in, mine was jammed a little so it made an awful sound when I tried to push it open, and it can only go so far before it hits the toilet. Not sure why they don't fix it to open out so you don't have to duck around the door.

Summary: Professional staff and a great group to work with. Food is above average for large groups. I would recommend to. They are pretty pricey, but we were able to get in on the ground floor when they were just opening their doors. Since, prices have increased markedly. Location is prime, with restaurants and shops within walking distance. Thanks Pasea!

Summary: The Pasea Treetop lounge is amazing.  The view of the beach and the surrounding area is stunning.  We had lunch and craft cocktails.  The flatbread was delicious but I found the Calamari a bit on the bland side.  My Pineapple Haymaker drink was a wonderful and refreshing cocktail.  The wait staff could not have been more knowledgeable or nicer!  Thumbs up on this vacation paradise!

Summary: The room and resort are beautiful, and the hotel's close proximity to local attractions is perfect. Late night room service was incredibly fast, and the balcony views of the ocean/pier at sunset are breathtaking. Came all the way from NYC and was definitely impressed, ill absolutely return here on my next visit to OC.

Summary: Amazing place, brand new, amazing stuff. We stayed there for a few days including new year's eve....really enjoyed. The room is fantastic and the view in hypnotizing....The best Hotel in Huntington Beach by far.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Rians big smile greeted us as we arrived and the welcoming warmth continued as we checked in and spent the next 4 days celebrating a wintertime getaway from Oregon's record rains. Totally delighted to find we had been "upgraded" to a corner suite with a view of pools, restaurants and of course, pounding surf. Spacious and sparkling with a most comfortable bed...and "lots...of small pillows." Loved them~~! Strolling distance to many fine dining options. A wonderful way to celebrate Valentines Day and we will be back and look forward to seeing Rian again. Good guy..great service.
Manager Response: We are honored to hear that you chose Pasea Hotel to celebrate your Valentine’s Day. Comfortable beds, fine dining, excellent surf, Ryan and the rest of our excellent staff will be waiting for you on your next visit. Thank you for sharing your visit and for your excellent rating.

Summary: Great location and you get what you pay for in terms of quality and amenities.  I wasn't used to CA pricing so items were more expensive than I expected, but the quality and service made up for it.  Beautiful views of the ocean from all the rooms.  Great hospitality and service.  Awesome location in relation to the beach, pier and downtown.
Manager Response: We at Pasea are happy to hear you enjoyed time in California. It is great to see that our staff was able to provide you with excellent service and a quality experience throughout your stay. The view of Huntington Beach and the Pier is something we admire every day and we hope you come back to enjoy it with us again.

Summary: Very modern and very clean. The Staff was very professional. Our room had a great view of the ocean and the bed was very comfortable. The pool area is very nice with a beautiful view of the ocean. Didn't eat at the in house restaurant, but looked very nice. There is a mall right next door with lots of fresh eating options. Very nice and relaxing time. Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our staff and our pool area. We take pride in our hospitality at Pasea and it is always great to hear about the positive experiences our staff helps create. We appreciate your rating and will be glad to see you back again soon. Next time we hope you can enjoy Tanners, our in-house restaurant, for its “hot food and warm friends”.

Summary: It was my wife's birthday and I wanted to pick a place to stay where we could easily walk to a restaurant. We couldn't have picked a better place. From the moment of our arrival, through check in and getting to our room, we were impressed. Everyone was incredibly welcoming and friendly. We had one of the best rooms in the hotel, an ocean front suite (thanks Olivia !!!). Pacific City is right next door and has a large choice of restaurants and bars. The beach is across the street and although we didn't take advantage, the hotel offers several complimentary items to help you enjoy the location. They have a large pool and patio deck and an outdoor bar that over looks the beach. The room was spotless and well stocked with amenities. Although we were here for a special occasion, we
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you decided to choose Pasea Hotel for such a special occasion. Even if you were not able to make it to the beach, it’s always great when our guests can take full advantage of the amenities and the local experiences Pasea offers. We are happy you chose Pasea as your birthday headquarters. Your glowing review and rating are greatly appreciated, and we hope you think of us again for your future special occasions.

Summary: Pasea Hotel, opened last summer, is beautiful, cheerful, staff seem to be enjoying their jobs.  Our view looked out over the pool and the pier beyond; watching the surfers from out balcony almost hypnotic. Food options remain limited in bar/restaurant (same fare for lunch and dinner), but the adjacent Mall has many other options, and the pierhead is a close walk.  Parking.....valet, prepare for the $35 nightly, as there are no other options.  Still highly recommended....

Summary: My mother came in from Vegas to spend the weekend with us, her daughters. From the valet, front desk agent, David from the bell staff and the receptionist at the lobby, we were welcomed with a warm smile and felt like family. We had never been here and they showed us all the amenities and features of the hotel. When we came down for the weekend kickoff lobby event, we enjoyed delicious wine and cheese. We had a young toddler with us and the general manager chatted with us and even brought over a nice stuffed animal of her choice. We have been here for less than a day and we have enjoyed every minute of it. This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff is genuinely friendly. I'm looking forward to coming back here again with my significant other.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel in January and loved it.   It is modern design but nothing crazy.  The staff was very nice and the rooms were great.  I had a very nice view of the ocean and the room was good size.  It is located within walking distance of a ton of restaurants and the beach.  I would recommend and I will stay here again.

The hotel has a great coffee shop inside the lobby, perfect to grab a cappuccino before you head out, or if you simply want a casual bite in the morning. I also believe the coffee shop also served sandwiches later in the day. The restaurant and bar area were lovely. We did not eat in the restaurant but we did have drinks and appetizers in the upstairs part of the bar. Service in the bar was great as was the design of the bar area. The appetizers were very good but not outstanding. The hotel also has a

Summary: Our room was excellent and the service was outstanding...the food was delicious and the view is amazing... everyone was very helpful...the rooms are very clean and I love the robe with flip flops..  Great trip overall..

Summary Heading: PASEA a luxury addition to the City of Huntington Beach
Summary: We were amused and enchanted by the new (8 months old) hip hotel & spa.This hotel just sprang on Huntington Beach,Pacific City with 180 degree Ocean Panorama.The ambiance is simply chick and the service is great.Upstairs lodge offer a fancy environment. The amenities  & features are not cheep but worth it  "at least for a short stay."

Summary Heading: Perfect spot to enjoy Surf City USA!!!!
Summary: Right when I pulled into the hotel I was treated by very good customer service. The hotel location is across the street from the beach, as all hotels are in Huntington Beach.  The lobby very open and beautiful, all amenities are located on one floor. Pool, Bar, Spa and coffee shop. Check-in was easy and simple. The rooms are amazing, very simple and comfortable. I would request I room on the high floor, as all rooms have a view of the ocean. The bed is comfortable and the bathrooms are very roomy and clean. The bathroom I had did not have a bathtub so only a shower. A very big shower. Overall quite at night when sleeping and very little disturbance. The amenities for the beach are amazing and you don't have to bring anything. I would recommend this hotel for a quick weekend

Summary Heading: New trendy hotel right on the beach.
Summary: We stayed here for four nights this yer.  The hotel is brand new, spotless and has a commanding view as it is right on the beach.  Rooms are fresh, clean and well appointed.The restaurant serves wonderful food.  Housekeeping services were a bit spotty.

Summary: We were there for the Surf City Half Marathon. I asked for a room close to the street so that my wife could watch some of the race. They put us in the room furthest from the street. Some of the toiletries were used and the bed was uncomfortable. The cost of parking is more than the other hotels on PCH.

Summary: I had a absolutely amazing stay in this hotel. Perfect location, nice view and direct access to the new pacific city mall. The rooms are very quiet, modern, very luxury and the service is outstanding. 5 stars! High five!

We didn't meet a single unhappy or unfriendly employee, and that was nice.   Some things you should know or consider: our first room was on the third floor with a partial ocean view. It was also right over the HVAC system and that was loud so we asked to be moved and we upgraded to full ocean view for $25/day. That room was 628 and was lovely. The rooms are fresh, modern and very well thought out indeed.   Again, wow - the staff :) Well done...

Summary Heading: Pasea Hotel in Huntington Beach, CA is a Great Hotel for Meetings
Summary: As a global meetings and events planner, I can highly recommend the new Pasea Hotel & Spa in Huntington Beach, CA. Summary Heading: Fantastic Resort for a Special Occasion

Manager Response: Dear Sam A,  Thank you for, once again, choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted to know how much you appreciate Paul's warm hospitality and we will be sure to share your comments with him. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us; we look forward to welcoming you back again soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Overpriced and worst customer service/employees I have ever encountered. I booked the B&B "special" and was practically charged DOUBLE with fees and taxes that were ridiculous!!! It rained the while time we were there, the $30 resort fee should have been taken off. My daughter is 8 so we couldn't go into the spa, even if we wanted to go into the heated pool it was closed as was the treetop bar. The food was awful and overpriced as Tanners and the woman that checked me out at the end of our stay was the rudest person I have ever encountered in customer service. She didn't care to go over the charges that I didn't understand were there at all and when I asked she snickered at me. There was suppose to be an $80 food credit which wasn't reflected AT ALL on the bill. She wouldn't
Manager Response: none

Summary: Needed a quick getaway from the storms and found a dog friendly place in the Pasea Hotel and Spa.  Our first experience with Peter K in the valet/bell service was warm and inviting.  Gave us a lot of information and was personable so much so that he greeted us each night.  My kids liked him so much they went to valet just to say "hello."  Got a similar goodbye from Cole and wished we could have recognized them more.  The room was modern, clean, and bright.  Ocean front was amazing views and all staff were friendly. Dog was welcome just about everywhere but we still asked if it was o.k. prior.   Hotel recently opened in June so almost everything is brand new and many perks with your stay.  Was not at full capacity at this time and not sure what it is like at high season but we
Manager Response: Dear littleyerl28,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. It was our delight to welcome your family to our resort hotel and we are so pleased that you had such a wonderful stay. Thank you for taking the time to share your review, letting us know how much you enjoyed our fabulous location, comfortable accommodations, dog-friendliness, and attentive service. We will be sure to share your comments with Peter and Cole, who will both be so happy to know how much you appreciated their hospitality. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and we hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Wonderful New Year's Eve weekend at the Pasea Hotel in Huntington Beach. Upscale without being stuffy. It was pleasant surprise! We were there for a four nights. Excellent location next to shops, great restaurants and bars-all within walking distance. We even had time for a quick drive to Disneyland. Our room on the 8th floor had a great view of the ocean and a nice terrace. The beds were outstanding-very comfortable. Great amenities, Frette robes, luxurious sheets and comforters, and a nice bottle of wine. The room was spotlessly clean, and nicely furnished with clean lines and soft ocean shades of blues and crisp whites. We will be back!!
Manager Response: Dear Joan A,  Thank you for celebrating New Year's Eve weekend at Pasea. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the comfortable luxury of our guest rooms, along with our spectacular location, deluxe amenities, and beautiful decor. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back to Pasea Hotel & Spa soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Great for work-super close to great shops and a variety of food.
Summary: Lovely, clean and spacious room looking out to the pier and shops. Leo at the front desk was super helpful. ALL the doormen were exceedingly polite and helpful. Tanner's staff was a bit annoyed with my to go food orders in the morning. It's too noisy (midweek even) for a quiet breakfast so I wanted to eat in my room. Evening to go was slightly better. Saint Marc and Lemonade give great options for food and endless desserts.  My work recommended the Hyatt-not only was this place newer, closer to shops/food, and more intimate-it was cheaper.  Fridge and coffee/tea maker was great as was the free bottle of wine (get new openers please).  Housekeeping was friendly and super helpful.  Spa was gorgeous and I enjoyed a yoga class on the lawn.  Definitely recommend for work, play, or
Manager Response: Dear Maritza M,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea while in Southern California for business. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the comfortable luxury of our guest rooms, as well as the friendly hospitality of our staff and our array of exclusive amenities. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and we hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: My husband and I spent a night at this hotel in December.   It was once of the nicest places that we have ever stayed and would highly recommend it!   After a long rainy drive from LAX, it was so wonderful to arrive at the Pasea.   The gentleman who parked our car could not have been nicer.   The woman at the front desk was not only extremely pleasant, but she provided us with all kinds of helpful information about the hotel and its surroundings.    The room was very clean and included a nice bottle of red wine.   We were also given complimentary pairs of flip flops.   The room had an umbrella for use as well as nice robes.   The shower products smelled wonderful.   Anywhere we went in the hotel, people asked us if we needed anything and were always willing to help.   The hotel
Manager Response: Dear FootballFanTampa,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. It's a delight to know that you had such a lovely experience at our hotel, enjoying the exemplary service provided by our staff, our array of deluxe amenities, and our fabulous oceanfront location. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and look forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We loved it from the time we arrived.  It is a beautiful hotel with lots of small touches that make it a memorable experience.  All staff so friendly, Friday night cheese and wine in the beautiful lobby, a bottle of wine in the room and flip flops for the beach.  Great location next to the Pacific Plaza which has good clothing and eating options.  Easy walk to Main Street and pier.  Room was very nicely decorated in a contemporary beach style as is the whole hotel. Beds very comfortable, pillows were a bit small. Wished we could have stayed longer.
Manager Response: Dear expatsaints,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so pleased that you had a wonderful experience at our resort, enjoying the coastal California decor of our resort, along with our deluxe amenities, spectacular locations, and the warm hospitality of our staff. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and are looking forward to welcoming you back soon for what we hope is a longer stay.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Great hotel, and the most comfortable bed we've ever slept in! The location could't be any better, right across from the ocean, attached to the brand new Pacific City outdoor mall, and walking distance to the pier and Surf City main street. We took full advantage of the complementary beach cruiser bikes to ride up and down the beach. The staff was wonderful. We'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear Peggy R,  Thank you for choosing to celebrate New Year's Eve at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so happy that you enjoyed our spectacular oceanfront location, our array of luxury amenities, and the warm hospitality of our staff. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us. We hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon for another wonderful stay.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Enjoyed a quick stay at Pasea while visiting relatives. New hotel built ground up. Good location. Clean, modern amenities. Fresh smell and nice beach decor. Friendly staff, good breakfast, spacious gym, stocked room, and a comfortable bed. Will come back.
Manager Response: Dear JustinDF,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea! We're delighted that you had such an ideal experience at our new resort and we truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us . We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Finally getting the opportunity to review the phenomenal Pasea Hotel, our stay in November 2016 was truly unforgettable and a spectacular backdrop to a surprise engagement weekend.  I had contacted the Pasea staff several days prior to our stay to alert the concierge of my engagement plans and request help in planning the perfect proposal.  I met with the VIP Services Manager, Christine, and Concierge Lead, Marty, to walk the hotel grounds and decide on a picturesque location for a sunset proposal.  The staff at the Pasea could not be more accommodating and their excitement in ensuring the engagement went off without a hitch truly heightened the experience.  Reserving an oceanfront room and requesting a high floor for incredible balcony views, Christine went above and beyond in
Manager Response: Dear Jason & Becky,  Congratulations on your recent engagement! We are honored that you chose to celebrate such a significant occasion at Pasea Hotel & Spa. Thank you for taking the time to share such a detailed review of your experience with us. It's a delight to know how much you enjoyed the luxury of our exclusive penthouse suite, along with our array of deluxe amenities and the attentive and gracious hospitality of our entire staff. It was our great pleasure to have you as guests at our resort and we truly appreciate your high recommendation and the excellent rating you have awarded us. We are looking forward to welcoming you back soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Ryan at valet is truly exceptional! Always welcoming and gracious and takes extra care to help. Such an asset to the hotel and as I am there repeatedly, he always remembers by name and what we talked about last time I visited.
Manager Response: Dear Longfellow123,  Thank you for being a frequent and loyal guest at Pasea and for taking the time to share your review. It's a delight to know how much you appreciate the warm hospitality provided by Ryan. We are very fortunate to have Ryan as a member of our team and we will be sure to share your comments with him. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and look forward to welcoming you back to Pasea again soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The hotel is great right on the beach and near the shops and entertainment.  The room was large and clean.  The staff was very helpfull.We had 20 people and they accomondated every one without problems.
Manager Response: Dear William O,  It was our pleasure to welcome you to Pasea Hotel & Spa for your Christmas party. We're so happy to know that you enjoyed our fantastic location and the warm hospitality of our staff. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us. We hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: As soon as you step into the hotel, you just feel relaxed. The atmosphere here is very laid back and even though this is a high end hotel, it does not feel stuffy at all. The room I had came with 2 balconies, one facing the beach and the other facing the mountains. Even though there was construction going on in front of the hotel, it was easy to ignore because of the breath taking views of the beach. The hotel room was very clean and had a stylish, sexy vibe.  I also tried to spa at the hotel. The spa was not that big and did not offer a lot of amenities, however, their services were excellent. I cannot wait to go back!
Manager Response: Dear Jessica G,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted that you enjoyed our cool, California vibe, along with our luxurious guest rooms, and your experience at Aarna Spa. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and we're looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We've stayed at this hotel at least two times recently, and we really liked it. The hotel has a elegant coastal ambiance with a comfortable/casual vibe. The floor plans are open and well planned, and the amenities are generous. The beds are very comfortable, and the views of the ocean and at sunset are amazing.  The use of colors and patterns throughout the hotel invoke a sense of style and serenity. The staff throughout the hotel are warm and accommodating, and there are many on site considerations for food, and beverages.   The valet staff has been very pleasant, but the valet fees are high.
Manager Response: Dear Suzanna H,  Thank you for being frequent guests at Pasea Hotel & Spa. It's a delight to know that you enjoy our California coastal vibe, array of luxurious amenities, and the warm hospitality of our staff. We greatly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and we're looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea again soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Recently stayed at Pasea... this is well designed hotel that is perfect for business or casual travel.  Great gym, pool, location, etc. The rooms are ample in size and most have balconies.   Helpful staff throughout the stay.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear j4fish,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the comfortable luxury of our resort and the warm hospitality of our staff. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel but they nickel and dime you
Summary: My husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend, Black Friday specifically. We didn't even know this hotel existed, but we were in town from Florida for a wedding and this is where the bride and groom had a block of rooms. It's a beautiful new hotel in a great location! You can't beat being across the street from the beach. We unfortunately did not have time to explore the hotel, as we were busy with wedding festivities. From what we saw walking through, everything seemed really nice and the staff was very friendly. I would have given them 5 stars based on that, but why only 2 stars then? I just felt completely nickel and dimed. I understand there are fees that are beyond the hotel's control that are mandatory, so just be prepared for 10% occupancy tax, 3% Huntington
Manager Response: Dear Stacey S,  Thank you for choosing to spend your Thanksgiving weekend at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so glad you loved our fabulous location and the beauty of our new hotel, as well as the friendly hospitality of our staff. We do apologize, however, that you were disappointed with aspects of your stay. We would love to speak with you directly regarding your experience and have sent an email message to the address we have on file for you. We look forward to speaking with you and hope to hear from you soon.   Very Sincerely,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We just stayed here for Thanksgiving weekend (4 nights) upon the recommendation of my sister who lives nearby. We're always game to try new venues. Pasea is a beautiful hotel. Fun lobby, cute ocean-themed art, friendly staff. They have all the components. But underneath the surface there are some real deficits. We would probably stay somewhere else next time. Too bad because my three teens loved the restaurants and shopping in the (poorly) attached outdoor mall. And I loved the local Equinox! (Sister got me passes.)  1.  Wasn't told of the resort fee of $30/room/night. Was told upon getting the bill that it included the pool, the flip flops, the pedicab (never saw that), the gym, the spa (which is extra), and the wine (told about wine at check in, "complimentary" should mean
Manager Response: Dear Liz S,  Thank you for choosing to celebrate Thanksgiving weekend at Pasea. We're so pleased that you appreciated the beauty of our new hotel and the friendliness of our staff. Additionally, we are grateful for all the feedback you have provided regarding various aspects of your stay. We are committed to providing exemplary guest experiences and will share your comments with the appropriate management teams at our resort. Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We look forward to welcoming you back to Pasea Hotel & Spa soon and in the meantime are happy to know you will be enjoying our signature wine.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Pasea Hotel & Spa has a beautiful area and views of the ocean.
Summary: We walked through Pasea Hotel & Spa lobby, restaurant and bar and it's a beautiful atmosphere to see and experience.  The views of the Huntington Beach State Park is amazing and the swimming pool is big!  Pasea Hotel & Spa is a stylish, contemporary modern-day hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Hawaiian555,  Thank you for sharing your review and collection of photographs from your recent experience at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the beauty of our new hotel and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: A very suitable, new hotel right along the beach.
Summary: This was my first stay at this hotel, and I selected it nearly at random due to its location relative to my business mtgs. I'm glad I did, as there were several things to like about the Pasea:  - Very helpful staff (in fact, when trying to check-in I almost fell like TOO many folks asked me if I needed help, so the service element is likely stressed by the mgmt here).  - Bright, clean lobby and common areas, and the pool area looks great (although I did not get to enjoy it).  - Bright, spacious and clean rooms, with a modern design and plenty of charging outlets for business travelers heavy on gadgets/equip.  - This may sound like an unusual "feature" to point out, but I found it to be tremendously helpful and to dramatically increase efficiency: the car valet accepts drop offs
Manager Response: Dear TRL954,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We are so glad that you appreciated our fabulous location, the comfortable luxury of our guest rooms, and the warm hospitality of our staff. It was our pleasure to welcome you to our resort and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in an ocean view double queen room on the 7th floor.  We traveled with our children ages 5 and 9.  The property is absolutely stunning and ideally located.  What stands out the most for us was the exceptional staff we encountered.  We were most impressed by Paul (head valet) and both Peters who assisted with our luggage.  These gentlemen were engaged, friendly and informative.  We were delighted by their positive attitudes and genuine interest in ensuring our stay was excellent.  We are already planning our next visit!
Manager Response: Dear Thomas H,  Thank you for choosing to spend your family vacation at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the beauty of our resort, as well as our convenient location and the stellar service provided by our team of dedicated staff members. It is always a joy to hear how the exemplary hospitality of our staff impacts our guests and we will be sure to share your comments with those you mentioned by name. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Spent the weekend with a friend - Fall for Bliss special.  The hotel is only about 5 months old and I think they've worked out any kinks that people have complained about.  Their staff were helpful and friendly.  The hotel was clean and accommodating.  Upon our Friday evening arrival there was a table set up in the lobby with wine, champagne, crackers and cheese - all free which was an unexpected bonus.  During our stay we used the spa which was comfortable and well stocked with towels and toiletries.  We both enjoyed our treatments (massage and facial).  We took advantage of the 2 hours of free bike rental - which we used to ride down to the pier for lunch (only about a .3 mile ride :-)  We didn't use our car all weekend because we were right next to Pacific City which has
Manager Response: none

Summary: Helped me with Xtra size armchair in room. Staff friendly helpful. Facilities good , pool plus hot tub large size. Lively rooftop bar.Expect high prices for all elements, but goes with territory I guess. Decor fantastic and really interesting all public rooms needed studying because of unusual nature of design and all the unique art and features, funky and tasteful comes to mind. We had great corner room with balcony on two sides, great for being nosey. Well done designer you intrigued me.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay at the Pasea Hotel
Summary: We recently stayed at the Pasea with our two children for a family memorial that was being held at this hotel.  We stayed two nights.  From upon pulling up to the valet the people that we encountered were wonderful.  David who was our bell hop to our room was probably the most remembered.  He spent the whole time going to our room explaining everything from the pool. the restaurants in and out of the hotel, what we can do at the beach.  When we got to our room he explained how everything in the room worked.  We got a partial ocean room and it was fabulous.  The hotel is fairly new....I think David said five months it has been open.  The room was spacious, clean and furnished very nice.  The shower was huge and had a sliding door so you could either see out to the ocean through
Manager Response: Dear Tina W,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea. We are so pleased to know that you enjoyed the comfort of your guest room, along with our fabulous location, and the exemplary service provided by David. We'll be sure to share your comments with him. Additionally, we appreciate the feedback you have offered us regarding your poolside experience; please know that your comments have been shared with our management team in an effort to improve our service. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: From the time we drove up and were greeted by the bellman Mark to leaving the service and experience was over the top. Great location, clean pool, excellent wait staff at every place in the resort. Make sure when you make your reservation you ask for Pauly, she was awesome.
Manager Response: Dear Bill V,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea! We're so happy you enjoyed our spectacular location, deluxe amenities, and the exemplary service provided by our staff. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and look forward to welcoming you back to Pasea.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Sparklingly new, but somewhat glitchy--I'd rate 3.5 if I could
Summary: When I heard that there was a new hotel in Huntington Beach, I was so excited to try it.  Pasea looks gorgeous online, and we were ready for some much needed break time at the beach.  We knew going into it that a new property will have growing pains and were prepared to be somewhat patient.  I guess the trouble started when we arrived much later than we had intended.  We don't like checking in late, because if you have special requests, it is much less likely to be granted.  But this time it was unavoidable and we pulled up at 2:00 AM.  I knew the hotel did not have any self parking and was valet only, so we waited in the driveway, but no one appeared.    There was no sign posted saying that valet services are not available after a certain hour, but after a little while of
Manager Response: Dear NativeSoCalGal,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa for your beach staycation and for taking the time to share such a detailed review of your experience. We are so pleased that you enjoyed our amazing brunch, your experience with our night manager, and our convenient Huntington Beach location. We do apologize, however, that your experience included inconsistencies with service and there were aspects to your stay that were disappointing. We appreciate all the feedback you have provided us; please know that your comments have been shared with the appropriate management teams at our resort, as we are constantly striving to improve the resort experience we provide our guests. We hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon for a stay that exceeds all of your expectations.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: From the valet when we arrived to the cleaning crew to the valet when we left, Pasea is a must stay hotel.  The view from the relaxing poolside lounge chairs was true paradise.  And just a walk across the street and your toes are in the sand.  Being connected to Pacific City is a huge plus, as you can walk to many great restaurants and enjoy the night life.  Our room said partial ocean view, but was definitely a great ocean view.  Without a doubt we will be coming back and highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is considering!!
Manager Response: Dera jpknutsen,  Thank you for choosing Pasea as the destination for your staycation getaway! We are delighted that you had a spectacular time at our hotel and truly appreciate the high recommendation and excellent rating you have awarded us. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another ideal resort experience.   Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Stayed at Pasea this past weekend on a brief one night staycation celebrating my friend's birthday. I have nothing but great things to say about the property and the people who work there. Katie and Brendan at the front desk were exceptional, they helped us during check-in and gave us some recommendations on things to do around the property. Our room was great, we were able to check-in right on time and and just in time for sunset, it was quite a view! We then went down to Tanner's for dinner, great food and drinks! I like the decor and specially the open kitchen setting. Kudos to management in general for putting it all together, will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Dear damiang25,  Thank you for choosing Pasea Hotel & Spa. We are so happy that you had such a wonderful experience at our resort, enjoying the comfort of your guest room, your experience at Tanner's, and the friendly hospitality of our staff. We greatly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and are looking forward to welcoming you back soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I am planning a weeklong meeting for 20 people in January to include meeting space and guest rooms. I reached out to 8 hotel/resort properties in the Huntington Beach and Palm Springs areas and Pasea was the only property to fail to reply. Despite 4 follow up calls and messages - including a voicemail to Annie King, Pasea's Director of Group Sales - not a single person person from the property contacted me, even to say they were not intersted in quoting. Astoundingly unprofessional. The moral of the story is that if you are planning a small group meeting, don't waste your time querying this property.
Manager Response: Dear MDWfrequentflyer,  Thank you for sharing a review of your experience at Pasea and alerting us to the situation regarding your attempts to plan an event at our resort. Please accept our deepest apologies. Be assured that this is not an accurate reflection of our dedication to providing exemplary guest service. We sent you a direct message several days ago regarding your event and ask that you please respond at your convenience. We are looking forward to speaking with you and hope to hear from you soon.  Very Sincerely,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Had an amazing time at this magnificent hotel over the weekend. Very modern and stylish from the moment you walk in. The hotel staff was extremely friendly including the spa staff. I would recommend a spa day for a massage. Rooms were great and so was the view of the ocean with private balcony. There is a $30 a day fee for parking but it includes Wifi and pool amenities. Definitely will come visit again!!
Manager Response: Dear PuertoRicoAngel,  Thank you for staying at Pasea while in Huntington Beach for business. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your experience at Aarna Spa, as well as the contemporary decor of our resort and the friendly hospitality of our staff. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea Hotel & Spa soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Amazing views, excellent service, top notch destination!
Summary: We stayed at Pasea for a work event over a weekend and were impressed across the board.  The view/location is amazing as it is right across the street from the beach but the restaurants/bars were great and the entire staff was top notch when it came to service.  It is walking distance to a ton of cool restaurants, bars, and shops.  We will DEFINITELY stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Andrea B,  Thank you for staying at Pasea and for sharing your review. We're so pleased that you enjoyed our spectacular Huntington Beach location and the exemplary service provided by our staff. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon for another fabulous stay.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Stayed at this new hotel after reading other reviews.  Enjoyed the stay very much.  I was there for a meeting in Irvine.  It was nice to return each day to a clean and comfortable room with a view of the beach and pier.  After a long flight, the check-in by Brandon was efficient and welcoming.  The room reminds me of a nice Japanese hotel.  The hotel was next to Pacific City with a range of restaurants and places for coffee.  A surprisingly nice touch is the very comfortable robe.  It was so nice that I even bought one when the hotel said that they could ship it to my house.    Overall, a really nice hotel in a convenient location with good views and outstanding staff.
Manager Response: Dear Black Lab Nickie,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa while in California on business. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the comfort of your guest room, along with the friendly hospitality of our staff and our spectacular oceanfront location. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The Pasea Hotel & Spa is a bit of heaven on earth. The theme throughout is water and nature. Every detail has been thought out and the vibe is Zen. I highly recommend you enjoy this property - definitely the jaccuzzi with the beach view.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: Pasea is pure class.  Excellent staff, rooms, grounds, rooftop bar, food, bathroom, and Anthony else you could think of.  It's attached to Pacific something mall (think Promenade, but brand new).  Awesome, just awesome!
Manager Response: Dear Brandon H,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa and for sharing your review and collection of photographs. We're so pleased that you had an excellent experience at our resort. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us. We look forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Nice but nothing special and over priced too
Summary: Nice new hotel, I wonder how long it will stay that way though, the furnishings are light which is nice but bedroom carpet is already shows signs of wear. They are modern with good bathrooms, as others have said though beware that most balconies don't really give a sea view, not quite what the website portrays.  I loved the location next to Pacific City and over from Huntington Beach. The pool area is far too small, particularly on weekends, it was crowded. Roof bar looked great but far too crowded and noisy. Restaurant for breakfast didn't work for us either, odd menu choices.  My biggest issue though is the valet parking, there is no choice but $35 on top of a resort fee of $30 (this clearly isn't a resort either), makes your room rate way over priced so my advice is to think
Manager Response: Dear shrop,  Thank you for choosing Pasea Hotel & Spa while vacationing in Huntington Beach. We're so pleased that you enjoyed our spectacular location along Pacific Coast Highway. We appreciate the feedback that you have provided and hope to welcome you back to Pasea should your travels bring you back to sunny, southern California.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I stayed here for 10 days, and is was so perfect! The staff made my trip, so nice and helpful. Had a great view of the ocean and pool. BEST PART was the concierge service that comes along with the stay. Emily P. was so knowledgeable in cool museum's, tours, hikes, ect all in southern California. overall best hotel I've stayed at !!!!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good stay, could have been better
Summary: Its a new, modern hotel.  It has a lot to offer.  The room was nice.  I was told I would have an ocean view.  Technically I did, but off the side of the building.  The balcony is awkward.  You can see into your neighbors room from your balcony.  The shower drain is a fancy modern design however it doesn't drain well because of it.  It was kind of gross.  The bathroom had a separate room for the toilet, which could be nice but it didn't really offer much privacy anyhow so it was more of a hinderance. The front desk gave me a bottle of wine when i checked in, but I don't know if it had anything to do with the group rate I was under or not.  They force you to valet, which I don't like at all.  I asked for a late check out and the woman at the desk was lying when she denied me and
Manager Response: Dear Joel1983,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea. While we are pleased that you appreciated our modern feel and the comfort of your guest room, we apologize that you were disappointed with your overall stay. Please know that your comments have been shared with the appropriate management teams at the resort, as we continuously strive to improve upon our guests' experiences. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Pasea in the future for a stay that surpasses your expectations.   Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Very nice hotel. Brand new.  We had an incredible view of the beach and the boardwalk from our 8th floor room.  The room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable.  This is a younger crowds hotel with a variety of partiers at the pool from open to close.   Most I don't believe were even staying at the hotel since they have no wristband or other way to know who is who.  We did see families get turned away due to them being at capacity.  No real big deal to us as we were at the beach every day.  The fireplaces shown on the website are not available to guests which was very misleading.  They are part of a huge area of the hotel used for special events only.  We did not receive any special gift upon check in as other reviewers did.  Rooftop bar was excellent for drinks.  We
Manager Response: none

Summary: We decided to check out this property because it was close to home for a short getaway.  The staff was friendly, rooms were clean and modern, and maid service quick.   The motif of the hotel was Surfing and they did a really nice job throughout the hotel.   Spa was a bit on the smallish side, recommend you tour it if you want to use the amenities before you book.   Fitness Center was Great!  Their restaurant had funny choices for breakfast, only one traditional eggs and bacon on the menu.   But overall a great stay at a beach hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Nanci I,  Thank you for choosing Pasea Hotel & Spa for a quick getaway. We're so pleased that you appreciated our coastal California decor, along with our deluxe amenities and the friendly hospitality of our staff. It's a delight to know that you enjoyed your stay and we hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: The Pasea was so amazing from start to finish. The moment you are greeted at the Valet the experience begins with gracious and courteous staff to fantastic accommodations! The pool is perfect and not too big with beautiful views. The spa was even more luxurious and the pampering could not have been any better! This has been the best spa experience I have had! The management & staff have got it right and make you feel like you are so welcomed & special! I could not have had a better weekend than this!
Manager Response: Dear CMC8560,  We're so happy that you had such an incredible weekend at Pasea! Thank you for taking the time to share your review. It's wonderful to know how much you enjoyed the gracious hospitality of our staff, our luxurious guest rooms, and your exemplary experience at Aarna Spa. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us. It was a pleasure to have you as a guest and we hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: This luxury hotel is a work of art!
Summary: This new trendy hotel with ocean view is a great addition to the area.  The design and appointments are gorgeous and jaw-dropping, everything is evocative of the ocean and surf culture. The room décor is just as trendy and artistic, and full of light. They bring the sunshine and ocean inside.  Complimentary wine and treats in the room is a classy touch as well.  Showers are luxurious.  I found myself taking photos in the lobby and everywhere.  But the prices are for well-healed surf bums. ;) Nearly double the Hyatt and Hilton. Book directly, Hotels.com was not cheaper. That said Tanner's restaurant attached to the hotel is very reasonable with great food and service.  Enjoy the view of the Pacific Ocean just across the street.
Manager Response: Dear Dragoniste,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're delighted that you enjoyed the cool, coastal decor and comfortable luxury of our resort, along with our delicious cuisine. We appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Went here for a Birthday getaway stay-cation. It was such a great experience. The people were so awsome and helpful. The hotel is so refreshing and just beautiful. The ocean view room was awsome. Our room on the north side had a view of the ocean, pier, and pool. The only only thing I didn't care for was the frosted toilet door. It's  nice but a little weird. Had a spa service and that was great. The relaxation room and garden are beautiful. We had an issue with the construction behind the hotel and it interrupted our relaxation time and we just had to leave. The roof top bar is a lot of fun and the view is awsome. This was a very enjoyable trip and I can't wait to go back. It was worth all the money we spent. There are also more restaurants I need to try.
Manager Response: Dear dgf40,  Thank you for choosing to celebrate your birthday at Pasea! We're so pleased that you had such an outstanding experience, enjoying the beauty of our hotel and the warm hospitality of our staff, as well as your experiences at our spa and signature restaurant. It was our pleasure to have you as a guest and we truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: My family and I are in CA for a week, staying at Pasea, and visited Disneyland/California Adventure while in town. We purchased 2 day park hopper tickets (the actual ones from the park, not the ones online that you can just reprint if you loose them) and upon returning late from the parks the 1st night, I accidentally threw  away one of our tickets. The next morning as we were pulling out of the hotel and heading to the parks for our second day, I realized what I'd done! We ran over to the trash can I had used, which was right outside by the valet. Ryan from valet was so great!!! He called Housekeeping to see if the trash had been emptied since the night before and also asked them for some gloves, as my husband was prepared to go through the can and find it. While we were
Manager Response: Dear theobsessedtravelers,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea while vacationing in Southern California and for taking the time to share your review. It is always a delight to know that the hospitality shown by members of our team has such a wonderful impact on our guests' experiences. We will be sure to share your comments with our team and especially with Ryan, who will be happy to know how much you appreciated his service. It has been a pleasure to have you as a guest. Thank you for the excellent rating you have awarded us. We hope you are feeling better soon and continue to enjoy your stay in beautiful Huntington Beach!  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: I stayed here from the 9th to 12th of October.  It is a really nice hotel and the room was spacious, beds comfortable, and even though we were next to the elevator shaft, I never heard it.  Wifi was included, a bottle of red wineThe view was breathtaking, over looking both the beach and the pool area.  I spent time at the gym which was well equipped and again the staff was over the top.  They asked which television I wanted to hear while working out, asked if they could do anything else.  The gym was well equipped and a great space to work out in.  The hotel had all the amenities from beach towels, chairs, flip flops, and anything else you could want.    I also stayed around the pool and dinner one evening.  This wasn't cheap.  Although service was excellent, a craft beer was
Manager Response: Dear Niteshadz,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We're so pleased that you enjoyed the comfort and luxury of your guest room, as well as our array of deluxe amenities, our spectacular oceanfront location, and the gracious hospitality of our staff. We truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us and we hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon for another fabulous stay.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: I would love to work there !
Summary: I choose Pasea for my birthday party. we went to tanners. we had a little bit of challenge to get to the valet, I didnt see any sign . maybe some will be helpful. They didnt validate your parking ticket !! you pay the whole thing ! and honestly I wasn't happy about this fact. Tanners is first come first serve. I wish I could reserve a spot in advance. the view is just incredible and indescribable... little pricey, I guess because of the location and the view . the team was super helpful .. I would like to thanks Phoenix from valet, he went beyond and above his role. He was super helpful. Felicha ( I hope I spell her name right) the roof top manager, thank you for your great hospitality you really made us feel great. and Finally MATT Madruga.. THANK YOU for what you offered ..
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 21st Birthday Celebration at The Pasea Hotel & Spa
Summary: This hotel is perfectly located close to the HB Pier and adjacent to the Pacific City shopping center which gives a wonderful choice of places to shop and restaurants to visit. The hotel's decor is beautifully decorated in a upscale surf/beach theme. The staff is very attentive and made sure to make our daughter's 21st birthday & nursing school graduation celebration special. Special thank you to the GM, Scott Blakeslee, for making sure our stay was perfect!!!
Manager Response: Dear doti22,  Thank you for choosing to celebrate your daughter's birthday and graduation at Pasea. It was our great pleasure to have you as guests at our hotel and we truly appreciate the excellent rating you have awarded us. We hope to welcome you back to Pasea soon for another extraordinary stay.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary Heading: Fresh and bright option in Huntington Beach
Summary: The location of Pasea Hotel is fantastic!  We love staying in HB with a view of the ocean and a quick and easy walk across the street to get to the sand and waves.  The walk into Pacific City Mall is also wonderful - shopping and restaurants right next door!  The lobby of the hotel is light, bright and airy.  We were fortunate to arrive on a Friday afternoon during a champagne/wine and cheese reception.  This was a wonderful touch to kick off our beach weekend.  Overall, the service was wonderful.  Many friendly employees available to guests.  It was refreshing to be greeted when walking thru the lobby.  The pool area is very nice.  Even though it was October, it was warm, sunny and the pool area was packed.  Bar and food service around the pool was efficient and friendly.   Our
Manager Response: Dear gogogo33288,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea and for taking the time to share your detailed review. We appreciate the feedback you provided and are so pleased that you enjoyed our convenient oceanfront location, as well as the gracious hospitality of our staff, our luxurious guest rooms, and our array of deluxe amenities. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to Pasea soon for another wonderful stay.    Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa

Summary: Had the pleasure to check out the Pasea hotel for a possible place to stay for my wedding. The hotel is amazing! Bright, modern decor, with a touch of California beach vibes! The staff in the lobby, tanners bar and even security were so welcoming. Paul, who works valet was very attentive, helpful, and excellent disposition.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with great customer service
Summary: It seems like this hotel has three types of room views. All have some sort of ocean view which is great. You have farther back from the ocean, one or two rooms from the ocean front and full on ocean front. We opted for the second type and were very happy. Our room looked over the pool but we still had a great view of the ocean. I'm sure the ocean front rooms are amazing as we could see their balconies from ours. The check in staff and bellman were wonderful and very helpful. We were able to have a drink by the pool and hot tub at night. Our server was a lovely young girl who had just moved from Chicago. I wish I could remember her name because she really made our night. The staff here is already great but she should be utilized to train any new staff because she had a wonderful
Manager Response: none

Summary: Let me start out by saying that the hotel grounds and rooms are impeccable and beautiful. Staff was superb. The location is excellent, we parked the car and walked everywhere all weekend. Saturday we sat at the pool had excellent service and watched the waves. Only downfall is the noise level here. I was kept awake past one in the morning from the noise from a (wedding/bar?) venue below. I was even wearing my silicone ear plugs. Saturday morning we were woken up early by construction noise from the apartments being built next door. I believe a quiet hotel room is imperative.  We were originally to eat at Tanners for dinner but changed our mind after reading yelp reviews. If you want some great food within walking distance try BLK Earth Sea Spirits and Dukes. We did go to the
Manager Response: Dear DirtDiva22,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Pasea Hotel & Spa. We are so happy that you enjoyed the beauty of our guest rooms, as well as the stellar service provided by our staff and our excellent location along Pacific Coast Highway. We do apologize, however, that the noise level during your stay negatively impacted your time with us. We do hope to have the opportunity​ to welcome you back to Pasea in the future, for a stay that exceeds all of your expectations.  Warmest Regards,  Scott Blakeslee General Manager Pasea Hotel & Spa
